description:
Amazing place, I've always liked coming here. 
They have recently increased their lunch price menu, but overall, I enjoy the food here. I'm not quite sure about the health score, but I have never gotten sick from eating here. You are immediately greeted when you walk through the door, and the staff is very friendly and hospitable. I generally come here for the days when I forget my lunch.

My favorite lunch order is the Scrambled Egg with beef.
author: Cyrus D.

description:
If you're into lots of quantity for a low price, Golden Kim Tar will satisfy. My parents are frugal Asians not particularly adventurous with food. Coming from an afternoon visit to the Asian Art Museum, we back to Civic Center and this place caught their fancy with the lunch special and familiar looking dishes. 

It was quiet during lunch, we were seated right away. Probably more of a takeout/delivery place. The service was very nice service and prompt. Complimentary egg drop soup and slices of oranges post-meal. They had generous lunch special portion sizes of both the main and the side of white rice (my parents love white rice). Mains are little on the oily side.

Five Spice Chicken - Fragrant but not too sweet. I feel like I'd enjoy this more with tofu instead of meat actually. A very generous serving of meat on top of fresh broccoli. The chicken wasn't that good quality, I had a few bites and left the rest for my parents.
Cashew Broccoli Chicken - The first thing noticed where the cashews whole cashews (not bits and pieces) and sizeable. The broccoli was cooked a little firm still and seasoned in a salty garlic sauce.
Beef with Mushroom - Only ate the vegetables from my parents dish but they were well seasoned but too much of the starchy sauce for my liking.
author: Truc N.

description:
Delicious! Wonderful, lovely Chinese cuisine. They delivered a fair distance too. 

Anyway, we got hot and sour soup (not great, not much flavor/not vinegary enough), orange chicken (superb! full of spice and orange peels/decent quality chicken), steamed rice (AMAAAZING! just kidding ;) ), crispy beef- delightful- crisp, flavorful, tender... garlic broccoli, which was cooked to perfection, also crisp, fresh, and delightful... veggies potstickers... quite delicious... 

The food was definitely 5-star as far as regular ol' Chinese food goes. The people were nice. Prices are fair.
author: Grizzle J.

description: So so glad I tried this place. It definitely satisfied my chinese food craving! I ordered the orange chicken and Kung pao chicken, both dishes were delicious! Really big portions too. They also sent a free order of vegetarian egg rolls. Will definitely order again
author: Hemali M.

description: Really good chinese restaurant. Friendly staff and generous portions. Definitely recommend this place. Give them a chance.
author: Epi S.

description:
Ordered through Door Dash & everything went as expected! 

You know when you're craving some tasty greasy msg filled Chinese food?! Well today was that day. We placed the order through Door Dash and it arrived within the hour #winning

Ordered: brown rice, general tso chicken & yee war wanton soup.

DELICIOUS! Pics attached of the war wanton soup. It was PACKED to the rim with wantons, meat, shrimp & vegi's. I appreciate that they did NOT skimp on soup fillings. The broth was flavorful & really hit the spot on this rainy day. The general tso chicken was great too! It wasn't overly saucy & had a nice flavor. I would prefer more spice, but all in all a great dish. 

**Did not see the Health Inspection rating until writing this review... I will most likely order again, but maybe wait until the score goes up LOL
author: Corina M.

description: I go here a lot when I am at work. However I order delivery.  The food is good and its affordable.  I have had no complaints at all. What I like about this restaurant is that when I order delivery via Grubhub or Eat24 is that they accept cash payment.  This feature really helps me because I honestly do not have a valid credit card that is working at the time so when that happens I have to use cash.  Cash is king.
author: Oliver D.

description: I ordered the Combination Wonton Noodle Soup and Fried Wontons. Not only was it delivered in 20 mins from the time I submitted my order but it was warm as though it just came out the kitchen. The fried wontons was crispy and well flavoured and as you can see from my pics the soup was overflowing with meat and noodles and very filling. The delivery also came with a side of free waffle fries and extra sauces. Will surely order from here again.
author: Leanna B.

description: Ordered 5lbs of chicken and broccoli, 5lbs of veggie delight, and 10lbs of fried rice and it was good for 15 people. It was hot upon delivery and middle of the road on flavor. The fried rice was best.
author: Sarah B.

description:
If I could, I'd give them 3 and 1/2 Stars, but it needs a bit work for them to earn a 4-Star for sure.

This is my go-to place for Chinese food delivery via Eat24. The neighborhood where the restaurant is located isn't the nicest so I have actually never been to the actual location. However, with Eat24, it's great!

I've ordered a lot from this place and the food are all pretty decent. Although usually the portion is huge, depending on the chef, it varies. Additionally, they will sometimes miss my instruction of "No onions or green onions," which is a pain to deal with, but you can count on Eat24's costumer service to sort it out. 

So far, there is only one item that I would never re-order and it's called Beef with Black Bean Sauce Chow Fun. Wow, this dish was sooooo salty! I usually say light on salt for my orders but I don't know what happened. Seriously, one can eat a bowl of rice with just a single piece of meat from this dish! Anyway, when I asked Eat24 to help me out, the restaurant said it's supposed to flavor like that and refund me $3 out of $7.95. 

I'd say just try this place out once and see it for yourself!
author: Alice L.

description:
Love these lovely people. Since moving back into the hood there's no straying, they are my go-to for my Chinese food cravings. Lots of veggies in the egg flower soup and a generous portion of pea sprouts - the always nice FOH woman even asked "all leaves?" Yasss please yum! 
If the packaging were more eco-friendly +1 more star!
author: eVa J.

description: No. NO! NOOOO! I ordered take out from this place, and yikes, it was a site to be seen. The restaurant was dirty, an employee was literally dragging a trash bag across the floor and through the restaurant, and another employee was sleeping under the counter when I entered. I didn't even eat my food, and I will not be coming back.
author: Kim A.

description:
Never say never! I recently gave Golden Kim Tar another try for delivery, since I saw their health score increased (slightly), and it had been a few years since I had left my negative review. I'm so glad I gave them another try! This time around, all the great qualities of my last review were still present. The flavors are delicious, the delivery is timely and the food is hot, the prices are reasonable, and the portions are very generous. And I am VERY happy to report that I have ordered twice from Golden Kim Tar in the last few weeks, and I have not had any of the side effects of feeling nauseous, as I mentioned in my last review. I have a feeling they probably stopped using a certain ingredient that causes side effects like that. 
I am SO glad I gave them another try, and they will be one my main places to order Chinese delivery from, moving forward. Their meatless General's chicken and garlic noodles are especially delicious.
author: Anna J.

description: This place is great for take-out.  I ordered the lemongrass garlic noodles, string bean meatless chicken, and the vegetable mapo tofu.  Portions were large at a low cost.  It satisfied my Chinese food craving, and I have absolutely no regrets.
author: Lisa F.

description: Ordered via eat24 and took about an hour. The portions were just ok - nothing fantastic, but I was really bummed out about my beef pan fried noodle - the sauce was really salty and didn't taste very good. My sweet and sour pork was also very dry and clumped together bec it was so soggy. I also ordered the beef with green beans and it barely had any beef in it. The only redeeming item was their seafood soup which was $5 for a half portion and it came with a lot of seafood! I was really surprised there were scallops, fish, fish balls and veggies. Would definitely order this again, but wouldn't be worth it with the other not so great items.
author: Anh Thu P.

description: An a bit below average chinese place. There's nothing particularly special about this place. We ordered garlic eggplant, chicken chow mein and honey walnut chicken. They were all ok, but again, there's lots of better options in SF.
author: Amanda L.

description:
This a review from my UberEATS experience, not a sit down and eat in the restaurant. 

So I was feeling slightly under the weather at work on Friday. Was totally craving roast duck wonton noodle soup. I pull out my iPhone and opened the UberEATS app, rifling through Chinese restaurants looking for roast duck. 

I stumbled on this restaurant that I had not heard of. I place my order and within a hour I was in heaven. I even called the restaurant to give them my love. It was so good that I didn't realize that there was no wonton. Next time she says. Lol

The roast duck noodle soup, and the beef stew noodle soup, was straight up comfort food for my soul. 

I'll be ordering here from now on, for their fresh juicy and fat roast duck. The beef stew is so tender, too. 

Thank you.
author: Pickle R.

description:
I love Kim!! We order from here all the time. The service is fast, food comes piping hot, super friendly delivery guy, and amazing prices!

I've never been let down. My favorite dishes are the Singapore noodles, duck fried rice, and their hot and sour soup is bomb.

They get to my place usually under 30 mins! It's amazing!
author: Debbie P.

description:
I went in and ordered take out.  Service was quick and friendly.  I ordered sesame chicken over chow mein.  It came with egg flower soup and an egg roll.  The soup and egg roll were all right.  Generous portions of food.  That's all the positives I have.

I didn't like it that the whole dish was wet.  I'm talking noodles and chicken.  It was so wet that the breading fell out of the chicken.  The chicken was also hard too.  It was a big box of food that I did not finish because I did not want to get sick. Dish was greasy to boot.

Also the picture of the restaurant on Yelp is not a true representation of the restaurant.  That's because the venue is several years older and it's dark and dirty.

Jury's out whether I will come back.
author: Wendy H.

description:
Ladies (and some Gents), you know that scene in Sex and the City where Miranda orders take-out from her favorite Chinese restaurant and she gets laughed at by the lady on the phone for ordering the same thing every time?  Well, this is that type of restaurant.  No no, not where they laugh or judge you for ordering the same thing every time (btw, meatless orange chicken is my go to), but the place that you always order your take-out from.  During my one month of living in the city, my roommates and I would order from GKT once a week like clockwork. So having never dined in this restaurant, this review is purely based on their delivery service and food.

Their delivery service is fast.  I usually get my food within 30 minutes of ordering.  I ordered from Eat24 one time and they were so fast the app didn't even have the chance to update the order status.  As far as the food goes, it's definitely not the best Chinese food I've had but for the price and portion you get, it's enough.  Their lunch menu items/combo is too much food for one person to eat. They also come with egg drop soup.  As I mentioned before, their meatless orange chicken blew my mind when I first tried it.  Combination chow mein lacked flavor and fell flat but they really pack on the meats (bbq pork, beef, and shrimp).  Their chow fun is delicious.  Egg drop soup could use more salt. Mongolian beef has way too much red bell peppers and lacking other ingredients but it's tasty and spicy.

If I ever live in the city again, I'd probably try other places, but GKT and I will always have fond memories of being young, broke, and practically homeless.
author: Anne D.

description:
Glad I took.a chance on this place.  My rating includes the delivery which went near flawlessly right to my hotel room. If there was such a thing as 4.5. ...

I was worried when the status never got updated, but they brought the order up to my room at Parc 55 and only 2 mins extra to do that.    The duck was really meaty , though it was also pretty salty, so beware that if you are sensitive to it; and the skin was well rendered. 

The egg rolls were small but tasty, more mini egg rolls, in more of a typical spring roll type wrapper.  But they work well and I suspect will do well as leftovers (what few I left... )

I will give these guys a shot next time too.
author: Al N.

description:
When I'm thinking "Chinese take-out" for dinner, Golden Kim Tar is my go-to for delicious and consistent food and service. The reason for the 4 stars is because that nothing ever WOWs me. The lady and her husband are really great, honest people which I love dealing with because I know every time I go in that it won't be a challenge just to get some General Tsaos Chicken and their Salmon Fried Rice. To me, that's one of the only reasons why I love this place because any restaurant that has salmon fried rice is my best friend. 
Honestly, they have been so consistent in their food quality and their service that I see why they are one of the lasting restaurant on the block. All but 3 out of 7 have stayed open during the wave, and they are one of them. But honestly, don't go if you're looking for a "nice and hip" spot to eat at. Go for the food and not the atmosphere. Other than that, once they get their remodel makeover in the years to come, I'll forever be their number one take-out customer :). But hey, the tenderloin is on a rise so I can totally see the owners getting their hands dirty with some cool new hip remodeling!
author: Nick A.

description:
Probably my favorite Chinese place in SF!

I can't say anything bad about the food or service!  I love the wonton soup, veggie fried rice, spring rolls and walnut prawns! 

Really anything you get I think will be great. At least I know for me it's that way! 

Super sweet staff!
author: Brianna B.

description:
This is my go to place for lunch when I have a job in the neighborhood.

They can be very busy but always has a seat for you if you are willing to share a table with strangers.

My favorite is the kong pao shrimps with brown rice, or string beans with chicken or shrimp, they give you a large portion and is always fast and tasty.

Even though they were closed down for health code violations but I hope they will maintain their new healthy standards for I like their food.
author: SJ L.

description: I came here yesterday with  my friends after going to the Asian Art Museum. We all got our own things. I didn't really know the names of anyone who was serving our table. There were two people on staff in the front who were just going and making sure everyone was OK. They were responsive to my questions about the food. I ordered the beef with black bean sauce with a side of fried rice. Delicious combo, first of all. And it wasn't too salty like other places end up making it. Finally, one of the staff, a nice lady, boxed my food for me. I am so used to doing it myself that it was just nice. Anyway, the place was clean and staff were on top of everything. Also, I love the decor. Very old style place and I know it's been in the city for a while.
author: Simon J.

description: Fast delivery of bad food. The garlic eggplant was terrible and had no eggplant flavor whatsoever. The General Tsao's achieved a level of extreme blandness that I had never previously experienced apart from eating paper as a child.
author: James P.

description:
I come here all the time. The neighborhood that it is in may not be the nicest neighborhood, but the food is great. My friends and I have become a regular at this point, and the lady always gives us free soup.

I definitely recommend the garlic chicken over fried rice.
author: Do P.

description: This place brings back good memories - cheap prices, enormous portions, which I love. Their duck is the best.
author: Silvestre R.

description: The food is always amazing :)! It is my favorite Chinese restaurant in SF! I recommend to you the orange chicken and the mongolian beef! I love the shrimp fried rice! Always on time and the food always hot!
author: Natalia T.

description: Yuck!!  Went here last week while visiting San Francisco.  While eating, I noticed a roach crawling on the wall.  I brought it to the waitresses attention.  She went and told someone else and neither one of them did anything about it.  Needless to say, this won't be on my list of places to eat at on my next visit.
author: Sheila S.

description: This is my go-to Chinese restaurant. Their portions are generous for their price point. Sesame chicken always comes out super crispy, even when I order for delivery! Chow fun is one of the best and I love their Chinese sausage fried rice.
author: Raeann L.

description: Ordered through Uber Eats and my order never came. And I'm glad because they have a health code violation. Never order from this place.
author: Thierry W.

description: My mom and I ordered Mongolian combination. Everything tasted great, with the exception of the pork. I also wish they had sauces for the wings we ordered. But everything overall was delicious.
author: Jasmine V.

description: the food is hardly edible here. I ordered the salt and pepper shrimp and it tastes disgusting. never coming back.
author: Nance H.

description:
This review is for delivery only- I've never stepped foot inside the restaurant. 
This is our favorite Chinese place in the city - the food is delicious and the delivery people are awesome. They always delivery quickly and are very friendly! 
And with the large portions, this lasts my husband and I days! Would recommend to anyone looking for a great Chinese delivery spot.
author: Deanna G.

description: Great Great Great!! The place that always going when i am so hungry. Very nice customer service and friendly. The food is so delicious they really open 7 days a week hardworking people.
author: Camelle Mae S.

description: The seafood soup is delicious plus their pork dishes are good!
author: Walter B.

description:
Based on food delivery.
I was craving for Chinese food and was browsing on yelp and found Golden Kim Tar. I ordered peking duck, chow mein, spring rolls, and they added a free salad. 

I was starving so everything to me was good! Ordered came on time based on EATS24 status. 

I haven't had Chinese foods in a while so if I have another craving then I will definitely order at Golden Kim Tar. 

P.S thanks for the free salad :)
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Let me preface with saying that if you don't want to be grossed out with the food you eat here, take your food to-go. The inside of this restaurant is so dirty that it's almost impossible to try and eat here.

I've gotten this place a couple of time to-go and the food is definitely ok. The prices are great for the portion sizes you get and I really like the taste of their ma-po tofu. This feels like authentic chinese food to me and they have a decent amount of vegetarian options. 

My one experience of coming into this restaurant to eat was not that great. We ordered the tofu basil sizzler and the dish looked super promising and came out of this sizzling tray. When the server finished pouring out the tofu onto the sizzler, I noticed a piece of shrimp on the dish. We asked for everything vegetarian so I was quick to tell her that there's this piece of shrimp here and she proceeded to ask if she could just take it out and that would be ok? Is that even a question? I was just a little off put by this and the cleanliness of the entire place and would probably never go back to eat here again. 

My recommendation is to get take-out if you're craving some cheap, hearty chinese food. They do delivery and they are pretty quick, just don't eat at the restaurant!
author: Malika R.

description:
Golden Kim Tar seems like the go-to Chinese restaurant for tenderloin residents. I can see why! It's cheap food with great flavor. I wasn't really a fan of the salt and pepper spare ribs but the scrambled egg and beef over white rice has me coming back. I actually CRAVE this dish! It's huge! Definitely two portions for me.

The lady that runs the front of the restaurant on almost any given day is SO nice. She seems to be working solo every time I drop in so I can't help but to cut her some slack. She takes phone orders, seats people, takes orders, buses tables, EVERYTHING. I feel bad that she's doing everything on her own! Service is on fleek though, considering it's a one man show in the front house.

I saw a small roach roaming on the counter the first time I ate here. But if you can get past that (which I kind of can nowadays after traveling all over SE Asia), this place is bomb. 

Take it for what it is. Peep the environment. You can't expect a fine dining experience.

TLDR: Good budget Chinese food. Huge portions. Can be a little dirty.

Pro tip:
Wipe off utensils... just in case :)
author: Jessica L.

description:
Super fast service.pretty good food. 
Really weird plastic chopsticks. :/
I got walnut shrimp with steamed rice. The dish could've used more walnuts. The rice was a bit overcooked. 
Plenty of sitting and very pleasant waiter.
I still prefer ken's kitchen because the food is somewhat better there but I should probably try more than one dish before judging.
author: Juliana B.

description: We really enjoyed this place, the food was so good and the employees we're so so nice. Next time in San Francisco we will go here.
author: Maria S.

description:
Golden Kim Tar has been consistent:  good food, fast service, pleasant delivery person, and the restaurant staff are nice. 

The lunch combo specials are a good price and have been tasty.  The menu offers a variety of choices that come with the entree, soup, and your choice of sides (nominal cost).  We have had:

Shrimp Hot and Sour Soup
Scrambled Eggs with Shrimp
Salt and Pepper Pork Chops
Chicken Chow Mein
Vegetable Chow Mein

All were very good.
author: Alex C.

description: We love Golden Kim Tar - it's one of our two favorite Chinese restaurants in the city. Last night's egg drop soup was especially delicious.
author: Davia L.

description: I ordered Shrimp fried rice and Honey Walnut Prawns for delivery. Twas the best tasting fried rice and prawns I've had in a long while. The serving size is huge for the fried rice so much I had leftovers for the next day. Not only did it taste good, I was very satisfied with the pricing being that it is in San Francisco where everything is ridiculously overpriced. I'm definitely coming back to this place and recommend it for anyone looking for good tasting chinese food.
author: Sir Robert I.

description: Food arrived on time and piping hot. The egg rolls were crispy, the seaweed salad was fresh and flavorful and the Roast Duck Wonton Soup was very very good even if a bit salty. The duck, noodles and wontons were excellent. I would definitely order from this place again.
author: Steven H.

description: Brought my entree way before my boyfriend and didn't bring soup first. Soup is sweet and sour,  not bad, actually with addition of soy sauce good. Didn't get our water. Jasmine tea yummy. Tony did finally get his, roast duck which came with fried rice and broccoli. Duck was heavy on the five spice, which isn't my favorite and Tony is not cooperating since waitress let homeless guy take table by the window. He is not eating so much as me but I'm really hungry. Don't know that we would come back, too many other choices,  lol
author: Kelly P.

description: This is for delivery only. The lunchtime menu is an amazing value. Try the five spice chicken.
author: Sharon B.

description:
Stopped by here for a quick dinner before a show at the Regency Ballroom (shout out to Watsky and Dumbfoundead!).The food is alright but the service is really good. We both ordered chow fun noodles--one beef and one veggie. Although the portion size was really generous, the noodles were a bit salty and lacking in ingredients.

BUT the service was so good. Our waiter was attentive and checked on us a few times. When we asked for the food to go, he politely helped us package our meals and even gave us warm wet towels to wipe our hands. I didn't expect this given that this is a casual neighborhood restaurant, but we were both pleasantly surprised. 

TLDR: Good place to grab a meal if you're in the area, although admittedly, there are better Chinese food options in the city. However, the service is wonderful!
author: Yanni L.

description:
I give this place a solid 4.5 stars because I'm always hesitant to give a Chinese restaurant 5 stars. Maybe it's because they always have the same slightly grungy feeling to them or I've never been blown away by any Chinese food as being an exquisite dish, but I can definitely see myself loving this place.

Within minutes of sitting down we already had a bowl of soup in front of each of us and tea on the table. The menu is pretty extensive and covers many of the main Chinese food dishes and there is also a pre-set menu for your large groups. 

I ordered the salt and pepper chicken wings with fried rice which was very good. The wings are pretty big and I liked the level of crispness without being extremely greasy. Yes I have has better, but these are by no means bad wings. They also came with a good helping of steamed broccoli. 
My grandmother ordered the mango chicken and I was very impressed with what they served. This restaurant seems to be trying to fight the idea of stinginess because there was more chicken on that plate than broccoli that was on my plate! And the mango... I've never seen a dish (even fruit dishes) come with that much mango. The sauce was delicious because I could tell they used real mangos to flavor it, let alone be a main part of the dish. Definitely a thumbs up considering most places give you what looks like leftover scrapings of meats and fruit amidst a stir fry of vegetables. 

All I'm all, a very good QUICK meal for very cheap. We were finished eating within 25 minutes of waking in the door, and each of our HEAPING dishes was about $7. Definitely a great deal for your money.
author: Kevin S.

description: The fried pompano fish is amazing.  The portions are huge.  Potstickers are not great and the waffle thing is a mystery.  But chow fun.  Fried rice. Veggie dishes and that pompano are just how I like em.
author: Marcus K.

description:
When I went to try this place I thought it looked great.

Unfortunately , the food isn't as appealing. I ordered the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodle and I got a soggy chicken with watered down garlic noodles. The noodles were basically swimming, unappealing. 

Fast service and reasonable price, that's it!
author: Ian A.

description:
Tasty American Chinese food! I've ordered delivery from here 3 times & it always arrives on time and hot.

I've tried 
- hot and sour soup- alright 
- crab ragoons- ok
- pork wontons- amazing! I always get it
- Mongolian beef- delicious. Flavorful. Great portion 
- garlic fries- good but not worth the price 
- orange chicken- hella good.

I will certainly order again when I want Chinese food
author: Wanda M.

description: Yum!  I think I finally found my Chinese place after over a decade of sampling many around SF.  Sooooo good....better ingredients and prep than all the others in the area by a long shot.  Give it a try.  It's high quality at a decent price.  Delivery was wonderful.  I can't wait to eat in as well.
author: John B.

description: I have ordered via e24 a few times and so far not disappointed. The other delivery options in TL are hit or miss. GKT is reliable and comes hot, well packed against spills and so tasty. I love all the veggies in the chow mein, and my favorite entree so far is garlic chicken. I want to try some of the meatless entrees so I know when veggie friends are over. The egg flower soup is also my favorite of all the TL Chinese places - the small size is a pretty big serving and is packed with even more veggies. I get so excited every time I end up burning my mouth because I can't wait for it to cool down!
author: Michelle W.

description: Delicious Chinese food and excellent service! We ordered a chicken plate, a vegetable plate and fried rice.
author: Catalina H.

description:
Ordered here with my team for work lunch. I ordered the Mongolian beef chow fun, and let me tell you, it was not fun at all! 

This large box of food only had 2.5 pieces of medium sized beef... 2.5!!! It also contained 2 slices of green bell pepper, and 5 sprouts. YES i counted. The rest was a bunch of cooked chow fun (super duper bland btw) stuck together. The whole meal was bland tbh. I think I had a few bites then pushed the rest away since i spent most of my time playing scavenger hunt for meat and veggies. 

We had delivery to our office and it was a huge order. This place couldn't label what was what? or put our names on there? There's a few of us with dietary restrictions and it was frustrating to figure out what was beef and what was pork. 

I think its safe to say, never ordering from here again.
author: Rehana K.

description:
This was one of the worst experiences I have had with food delivery.

First off, we ordered off Eat24; my co worker put in the order at 11am today, not only did we not receive the food until after 2pm; the driver was rude and argued with me through the phone on where the drop off was, and kept yelling that he was here and that I wasn't when he was the one at the wrong place.

After making several complaints through Eat24, not only were they dismissive, they pretty much ignored this whole situation. 

We had much better luck through Grubhub and Postmates. 

We waited for almost 3 hours for the food, where were you coming from? Sacramento? I thought the restaurant was located only a mile away from us? 

We received cold food, and got yelled at by the delivery man. 

Complaints were all dismissed... 

We'll go elsewhere, thanks Briana.
author: Tiffany L.

description: A great place for lunch in the Civic Center area. Prices are reasonable.  Rice plates are served with a bowl of soup and a fortune cookie. Also comes with hot tea. Typical Chinese fare.  Food is tasty.  Restaurant can get very crowded during the lunch hour.
author: Steven L.

description: Order the salmon & chicken fried rice.  Fantastic!
author: Kristen S.

description: Great greasy Chinese food. Large portions for the money. Try the mango chicken or beef! Large selection of dishes!
author: Debbie C.

description:
I got delivery - the food arrived hot, fresh, and it was all tasty.

The hot and sour soup was nice and spicy. The General Tso chicken (requested sauce on the side) was nice and crispy because they added a bunch of dry fried noodles in the bottom to soak up the moisture. The crab rangoon was exactly what you'd expect from a crab rangoon (maybe a bit short on cream cheese, but that's not a bad thing). The free salad that came with it was a bunch of lettuce, some grape tomatoes and a tub of thousand island - no complaints, but a bit out of place.

Still, the delivery was quick, the food was hot - I can't complain.
author: Harley C.

description: The restaurant is pretty cramped and had an authentic Chinese restaurant feel to it with which comes unsurprising sub par service. Waiters did not come by much and when they did, it was a bit difficult to communicate with them. I ordered the sizzling basil beef which came very quickly. Portions were pretty large for the price however I did not think the food was amazing by any means. All in all this is a typical Chinese restaurant that does not differ from any other Chinese place but if you need fast food and larger portions, this is a good option.
author: Tuvshin T.

description: I have been a customer for more than 10 years. When you factor in convenience, the quality and variety of dishes, service, and location; 5 Stars!
author: Joseph T.

description:
Too much "golden" and not enough, um...well, actual food. I really wanted to like this place as a friend had mentioned it a couple times and said how good the vegetarian options were. Sadly, I found that everything was quite over-fried and on the bland side. 

Though I love scallion pancakes, theirs were so fried and flaky that they fall apart in your hand as you ate them. For my main dish I ordered the meatless orange chicken and it was equally disappointing. The fake chicken was quite bland and there were no veggies with it!

I'm giving them two stars simply because they do have fake meat/vegetarian options, but really there are plenty of places (at similar price points) that deliver a much better value.
author: Jon T.

description: The food here tastes amazing & the prices are great! You can easily eat here for under $10. The waiters are very welcoming & they will make the food right away!
author: Clara S.

description:
Ok, this place is straight up mediocre chinese food. But on the walk home from the Bart after hitting up the bar, it's exactly what I needed.

Their lo mein isn't anything special. But it's exactly what I wanted. Thick noodles & some veggies!

The one dish that stole the spotlight for me was the eggplant tofu. The lady asked if I want it spicy & I told her yes. Chinese food is not usually spicy to me (even Szechuan), but they made this dish perfectly. The tofu was fried, but still soft. The eggplant wasn't mushy or slimy! And it was perfectly seasoned. I will definitely be back to order this dish. 

The vegetable dumplings are ok. 

Also, I've been here a few times & it's never crowded.
author: Amber G.

description:
You know how you always need a dependable go-to Chinese place for pick-up because you never know when you really need to down some sloppy noodles and garlic chicken late at night? Well, this one isn't mine, but I guess it could be if I lived closer to the Tenderloin. Jamie W. and I were starving after a marathon community awards ceremony at which he was the recipient of four well-deserved citations, so afterward, we braved walking down Turk Street close to 9PM to grab something to eat here. No surprise that it was nearly empty with only one other customer in the place slurping some soup quite loudly.

It's bland stuff they serve here. It doesn't offend, it doesn't thrill. It's just the type of Chinese food you eat and promptly forget an hour later. But I'll try to explore the bowels of my subconscious and remember what we ordered. Oh yes, we had the $5.95 Fried Chicken Wings, pretty good value (you get eight...but who's counting) yet nowhere near as good as the ones at Capitol in Chinatown and strangely piled on a bed of fried noodles as if there wasn't enough grease on that plate (see photo). Next up was the $8.25 Mongolian Beef, which was overtaken by onions and lacquered in an inexplicable brown sauce (see photo).

Speaking of which, the brown sauce showed up again in the $7.25 plate of Sauteed String Beans (see photo), which really tasted like the vegetarian twin of the Mongolian Beef. But hey, how picky can you get near 10PM on a weeknight? The woman serving us frankly couldn't be more attentive, and the food came out in record time when we just wanted to wolf and bail. It's also a semi-scary part of town, so you don't want to be loitering too much later anyway. But Golden Kim Tar is what it is, so give the place credit for being no less.

FOOD - 3 stars...lots of brown sauce here, but I can still eat it
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...well, there are plenty of tables at this hour
SERVICE - 4 stars...she was always ready to serve us
TOTAL - 3 stars...when you need a go-to place to go to...late in the evening
author: Ed U.

description:
I ordered lunch for myself and some co-workers from here through seamless.com.  They delivered the food 45 minutes from the time I hit the submit button on the site - that's really good considering the area I work in.

Feedback was positive and everyone seemed to have liked their lunch and their lunch specials are a good deal.  I personally ordered the Scrambled Egg with Shrimp - it was really good.  The eggs were fluffy and not dry at all, also the shrimp was tender and not under or over done.  It came with broccoli on the side as well.  It was my first time ordering delivery from this place so it'll be a go for more.
author: Emy B.

description:
Good food, huge portion!!!

We ordered 2 plate and it was huge and it would last for both dinner and lunch.
author: THanh H.

description: I was a bit skeptical at first because of the appearance, but I gotta say, the food was great... Big portions and good food. I will definitely recommend
author: G R.

description: Not commenting on the quality of food.  We tried to order for a party at 11:00 am since the info posted says that they are open at 10:00 am.  After many unsuccessful calls until 10:30 am, we had to try to get food somewhere else at the last minute.  Should keep hours open updated so people can plan accordingly.
author: Jeannie W.

description: I no longer live in the area, but this is where I eat when I'm back. The service is always friendly. I really appreciate the effort made to add tasty vegetables to the meat dishes. I always feel healthy and satisfied when I leave. Everything is scrumptious, but my favorite are the bone-in chicken and duck dishes.
author: Helena L.

description:
8-3-16
Very clear communication Female Waitress Spoke English and Chinese.  No language barrier.
Polite but very busy staff.  
#53 Five Spice Chicken with rice and a coke.
Not one time.  Not two times.  But 3 times.
Did not get the Five Spice Chicken.  Three times on 3 different visits I was brought regular chicken with the skin on it.  The chicken was bad-freezer burned?  Old?  moldy?  Something was there that should not have been.  #53 Five Spice is $12 and luckily at least they charged me the $9 for their health code violation tasting chicken.  The fish sauce was likely old or not properly stored as well.  The fish sauce had an old off taste as well.  How can you mess up fish sauce?

The restaurant has a positive letter from Yelp saying all their posts were at least 3 of 5 stars and Yelp congratulated them. The letter posted to their door is from 5 years ago.
Only the  coke had a regular safe coke taste.
I am constipated but I thankfully the moldy chicken should take care of that.
I am not going back.  The Health Dept should go back. I won't.

Update to this post 8-4-16:
Since Golden Kim Tar is having serious "issues" with chicken I found a wonderful place today not far from them that served a delicious Five Spice Chicken that Golden Kim Tar could not.  My very first visit at MANGOTEEN was perfect.  The chicken was 10 stars out of 10...perfect!  juicy not dry, falls off the fork tender and of course very very delicious.  The "Five Spice" Chicken  at Golden Tar is $12 and terrible while at MANGOSTEEN the same meal is just under $9 and delicious.  MANGSTEEN is smaller with less seating but well worth the wait.

MANGOSTEEN
601 LARKIN ST
SF CA. 9409
415-776-3999
MANGOSTEEN RESTAURANT
author: John D.

description:
Letdown.  I was drawn here because of two simple facts:  #1.  I was having a lazy day and this place was only a block from the office, and #2.  I was dying for some crab rangoon.  Not the most stringest of standards, but sometimes I'm easy.

There were definitely a good number of tables when I arrived around noon to grab my takeout, so I almost regret doing a grab-and-go.  Anyways, I ended up with the chicken fried rice and crab rangoon.  The crab rangoon was ok (if you're ever in Chicago, get your ass to Polygon Cafe or Tamarind for a real crab rangoongasm), but it ended up being my whole lunch.  Yup, the fried rice was so bland and tasteless I threw the whole thing out.  This definitely made me cry, because it could've been enough for at least two lunches, and a dinner or two (seriously, portion size was huge).  Thank god it was only six bucks, so I didn't cry too hard when I threw it out.  Boo.
author: Jen R.

description: I used EAT24 for the first time the other day and had Golden Kim Tar deliver to us in the SOMA. The food arrived on time and piping hot! We ordered Wonton with Red Chili Oil, Combination Hot and Sour Soup, Salmon with Asparagus and String Bean, Salt and Pepper Calamari, General Tsao's Chicken and Sizzling Basil Beef. We had asked for spicy on the Chicken and Beef dishes but neither was that spicy. There was a punch but no kick. The Wontons were really good and the Combination Hot and Sour Soup was a total surprise for us in terms of taste and contents. When I read "combination," I expected meat and seafood since the other options were seafood, chicken, pork, beef or vegetable, but instead, the soup contained Wontons, pork, chicken, vegetables all mixed in with the Hot and Sour Soup. It was actually really tasty and every spoonful was a surprise. The four of us enjoyed our meal and it was just about the right amount for us. We had two big eaters and two moderate eaters. The quick delivery and ease of ordering online was a plus. Also, the staff was able to effectively communicate with me when I called to add an order of steamed rice.
author: Jen L.

description: Went here with friends after the SF Giants parade! All I can say is that they have good food and really great service! I ordered their chicken wings with combo fried rice. Will definitely come back! :)
author: Mia O.

description: Eew is all I can say! The rice was bland and in lumps. The general chicken did not look like chicken, it was more like rubber coated with cornstarch. General chicken with fried rice is a no no! My coworkers and I ordered lunch for delivery and the food arrived cold. They did end up sending 3 egg rolls with it though (for free). However, that was nasty too. Ate 1/4 of the lunch combo and threw the rest away. It was like that nasty Chinese food where you want to throw up after. Don't go here!!!
author: Sonya L.

description:
My office loves this place.  Whenever it's a random post-holiday work day, oh like maybe Black Friday, we order from here and no one complains.

It's exactly what you're looking for in take out Chinese - nothing fancy, just solid and good.  It's not too greasy, but just greasy enough. The Orange Chicken is my favorite.
author: Lisa R.

description: The food was okay, I had ordered chow mein with chicken, won ton soup, and there appetizer combo for 2. The chow mein noodles where soggy and salty but that mostly what you'll also get if you order food at china town so no complaints there. The appetizer arrived cold so it was hard to chew since it was deep fried. The only plus is the big portions! Bid portion for cheap is not a bad deal.
author: Tri N.

description: Found a new item on the Golden Kim Tar Chinese Restaurant online menu - listed in appetizers that i never tried was the "Green Onion Pancake" so ordered it along with my chicken won ton and egg noodle soup (which is always outstanding).  Upon putting the sauce that came with it (a delicate peanut puree) and eating it with fingers (hey I am Hawaiian [and Chinese American) it was more like a dessert cookie that I would have eaten AFTER the complete meal.  I recommend this as a compliment to your meal afterwards rather than an appetizer before,  To me they are the best Chinese restaurant in the Civic Center - Little Saigon - Downtown - Tenderloin.
author: Tamara C.

description: All the food came out quick and delicious. Have been here a few times before and never reviewed it. But this place is friendly and my grandma comes almost every other day to this place. I think the good should more expensive for the quality they make it and how fast it's out. They also have current music playing in the background so no awkward silences. Would definitely come back to this place for with lunch or dinner. Thank you so much!!!
author: Diyan S.

description:
AWESOMEEEEEE FOOD. those friking   honey walnut praws man are the best.

The place is pretty clean came with my wife the other night a lady i guess the owner. served us she was very polite smiled all the time.

over all im hella recommending this place to my friends :D
author: Jorge O.

description:
I ordered a delivery meal, and got very disappointed when I looked at the chicken wings and noticed how hairy they were. I almost had to take them to the barber. The crab ragoons were really chewy and poorly stuffed.
The only thing that I could actually eat was the salad. 
I wonder if I can complain at eat24, because ordering from this place was a total waste of money and a disappointment. :-(
Never ordering from here again.
author: Ana Carolina J.

description: This is one of my favorite places to eat around civic center.  When I go to school at The Art Institute of California San Francisco, Golden Kim tar is one place where I feel like home since their food taste original and people are super friendly to everyone equally!  If you are looking for a lunch or dinner place with minimum wait time, maximum return, great service and a affordable price, definitly check it out!
author: Alex Z.

description: The best experience ever especially on Christmas!!! Food was still hot when it arrives to our hotel room and only took about 15-20 minutes from when we ordered it. Considering how far we are from Larkin street that's a really good time.
author: Kalyn L.

description:
I ordered delivery from here and was overall really happy. The food is fairly standard takeout Chinese, probably slightly better than average.

They forgot the pancakes for my mu shu, which was disappointing since for me that's the key component. I called just to let them know, and without  my even asking she offered to deliver more. I hadn't expected this since it's a whole trip for such a small thing, but the woman on the phone was very nice, as were both delivery guys.

I see a lot of reviews of bad service on here, but I definitely had the opposite experience.
author: Derek S.

description: I eat here almost everyday, fried rice is amazing and always made the same. The staff is very friendly and always remembers to put my sauces with my order. I love this place, I've tried the General tso's chicken (which was amazing!) The BBQ pork (which is very yummy)
author: Bethanie M.

description:
You have many choices for Vietnamese and Thai cuisine in the Civic Center/Little Saigon area.  But there are limited choices for Chinese food with Golden Kim Tar being an option. I was working out of my SF office recently and several of us decided to get Chinese for lunch and we headed across the street to Kim Tar.  The restaurant has many tables that seat four and six.  

I ordered the Singapore noodles, which consisted of curried rice vermicelli noodles with thinly sliced pork, shrimp and eggs.  The dish had a right amount of curry and was tasty.

If you happen to be in area and craving for Chinese food, Golden Kim Tar is a good choice.  Oh, the restaurant has one of the cleanest restrooms I have seen.
author: Al L.

description: I got home from a long trip craving veggies and some simple chinese fare. Golden Kim Tar delivers quickly and have very good vegetarian options. Food is so expensive now, but their portions are quite decent and arrive hot and fresh. Worth a hike to the restaurant. Thanks Golden Kim Tar!
author: Roxmarie M.

description: Terrible food. Chicken didn't taste like chicken. Long, stringy Asian people hair was in 3 separate dishes. Crab Rangoon was missing the cream cheese. All the food tasted old. Will never eat here again.
author: Tim O.

description:
The food was average and arrived fairly cold but this review isn't about the food.

It took 55 minutes for delivery and I think that's a long time but this review isn't about the delivery time.

I won't order from Golden Kim Tar again because the person that delivered the food was extremely rude.

After waiting almost an hour finally my doorbell rang, I stood up and headed down the stairs and after about 20 seconds it rang again. I realize you may have more food to deliver but give me damn minute before you get impatient. The guy had the food in one hand and a sheet of paper in the other and demanded $17, the actual price was supposed to be $16.80. I offer him a $20 bill, he handed me the bag snatched the $20 out of my hand and stomped off without even mentioning my change. I was going to let him keep it but don't think he should have assumed I was.

I almost forgot to mention, they didn't even give me a fortune cookie!
author: Manny F.

description:
They have come through consistently, again and again, and it's consistency we all want, right folks? Well the friendly people at Golden Kim Tar have it, and their chow mein is always right, their Crab rangoon is always slightly crispy on the outside, chewy inside, etc.

I love this place. best Chinese place in the Larkin/Polk area.
author: Stevie D.

description:
2016 Happy new year guys.

Roach in the delivery bag wtf....
author: Chihan L.

description:
I used to order delivery from here a lot since they're one of the few places open in the mornings. But the last time I ordered, I got the "Yee" wor wonton soup, and it came with fried wontons in the soup. Yuck, seriously?

So I called and asked why they would put fried wontons in soup, and they actually meant for that. I thought they just threw unused ingredients in my soup. Oh well, done with it.
author: Derrick V.

description:
I am absolutely obsessed with Golden Kim Tar. Allow me to craft a list of all the reasons why:
1. HONEY WALNUT CHICKEN. Oh my goodness. Amazing.
2. Fried rice. Enough said.
3. Every single time I walk in there, I feel like the prodigal child. SO friendly and welcoming!! 

I've eaten at A LOT of Chinese places in the city, and this is the best by far. Do yourself a favor and try it- you won't be disappointed.
author: Brittany P.

description: Lady at the front is always really nice and really warms up to you the more you come in. Always offers delicious jasmine tea.
author: Vivvi T.

description: Authentic Chinese food, fast, cheap and delicious. I have been here for 10 + times and recommend the lamb stew, rock cod with black beans and curry chicken.
author: Dong A.

description:
1.  Good Chinese food.
2.  Review of delivery from Golden Kim Tar.
3.  Easy to order via Grubhub.com.
4.  Mongolian Beef has a nice spice sauce.  The veggies were fresh and cooked just right.  They still had that little crisp snap I like.  The beef was tender.  The portion was very generous.

http://tinyurl.com/4tn89yz

5.  General Tsao's Chicken - It was not quite as spicy as a I like it.  It was crisp on the outside and tender on the inside.  It was still pretty good.  I do wish restaurants would have it in their description for Tsao's Chicken if it is going to be on a bed of broccoli.  Over the years, I could have fed a small village with the broccoli that I've thrown away from General Tsao's Chicken.
6.  Very low minimum order for delivery ($10).
7.  Delivery was very fast, prompt, and polite.
8.  The order was neatly packed.
9.  My fortune was "You will do well to expand your horizons".
10.  And if you are playing the lottery, the lucky numbers were: 
         13, 16, 19, 26, 29, 48 - If you win, I should get a cut.
author: Mark D.

description: I ordered a take away of black pepper chicken and Kung pao chicken with steamed rice. Loved how they packed it up neatly and with good portion of the meat and rice. It was tasty and would recommend the place to friends!
author: Annika J.

description:
I've actually been pretty satisfied with the food from Golden Kim Tar. So much so that I've ordered delivery from them about 20 times in the past year according to my eat24 account, but today will be my last time ordering from them.

First of all, the driver demanded a tip. Yeah, that's never a good sign. Next, I take my food inside and set it on my counter, only to find that the container holding my extra hot Kung Pao chicken had exploded all over, ruining both that dish and the one on the bottom. The food itself was piping hot and I burned my hand in trying to save the dish below it, but I had to toss out most of the food I'd ordered. I got back on live chat with eat24, they're great as always and saved the day and refunded me.

However, this is what happened when the restaurant called me while trying to resolve this, which is why I'm taking my case to Yelp. I got a phone call from a woman at Golden Kim Tar who I had a very tough time understanding as her accent was very thick, she was also loud and didn't listen to what I had to say. She first demanded I give the damaged food back, which I was incredulous at since most of it is now in my garbage. So I asked, you really want me to give you my garbage? Apparently yeah she did. I then made my own demand of a refund, and all I heard on her end was some unintelligible yelling and then she hung up on me. Sorry guys, you lost a loyal customer with some unacceptably crappy service.
author: Patricia M.

description:
Full disclosure:  I hate chinese food.  

Yes, you heard me right:  I hate it.

Please, don't start with the whole "I just haven't found the right place" nonsense.  My Chinese friends are always dragging me to some godforsaken place in Roland Heights, or Alhambra, or Stockton swearing on their grandmother's ghost that THIS will be the place that will convince me that Chinese food isn't terrible.

All to no avail.

So imagine my surprise when near starvation late on a Thursday night brought me into the only place open within blocks in a somewhat sketchy landscape where no doubt crack was more readily available than food.  They were about to close, but they could see the desperation in my eyes, and without even handing me a menu my server said:  what would you like?  I stammered a bit about liking kung pao shrimp and spicy eggplant, and in less than 10 minutes I was  served one of the best Chinese meals of my life.  

Amazing service, amazing food:  fresh, flavorful.

Then, a week later, I said to myself, "I wonder what Yelp thinks about this little place?"

And lo and behold, I don't seem to be in the minority.  This place is fantastic. 

Go.
author: Paul M.

description: Service was quick and the food wasn't bad. Right across the street from the federal / passport office so it was nice to have a meal that didn't take long. All three of us ordered the lunch menu: Kung Pao, Beef Broccoli, and Assorted Veggies with Beef and all three dishes were good. The best part was that the portions were big and the food came out hot. The place was maybe half full when we arrived, but it seemed the place was nearly full as we left.
author: Barbara G.

description:
The food from here was really fresh and very good. For take out Chinese we really enjoyed the food. We also had it delivered from Grub Hub and had a good experience this time. We realize delivery is hit/miss but we are glad they cooperated and got us our food timely, affordably, and it was good. When we called to ask a couple of questions about the menu they were also super friendly. We'd recommend this place for takeout.  We haven't been inside so I can talk about what the in person experience is like. Thanks for the good food and good service! :) 

We had the crispy beef, fried rice, veggie chow mein and general tsao chicken and it was all delicious. My favorite was the chicken and the rice and they were really good left over. We ordered a lot of food so we could have leftovers and it was just as good if not better than fresh.
author: Brent T.

description:
I ordered through seemless, which I got a 5.00 coupon on my 1st order. I never got a confirmation email, but never the less it showed up and within 30 minutes, so kudos. I got the mongolian beef and sauteed string beans. It was hot, fresh and best take out I've had in a longtime! Beef was spicy, but not too hot. The string bean nice, not too crisp, not overcooked. I must say they were perfect!

Ordered again (seamless $7 coupon for 2nd order). this time not as fresh, but still above par
author: Liz B.

description: After finding this little gem I have shared it with every friend,neighbor, co-worker...anyone who's looking for a great Chinese spot in the TL. My boss is hooked! He called me on a Saturday to ask for the name because his wife just had to have the fish that he had brought home one night after work (they live in Daly City) I will keep trying everything on the menu, even the vegetarian dishes because I have never been disappointing by this place. Be advised that is gets super crowded during the lunchtime hours M-F but you can always grab a seat and make a new friend. The weekends are super chill and is somewhere you can sit, enjoy your meal and catch the occasional sports game. The staff is very friendly and attentive.
author: Maganda R.

description:
Not my 1st time dinning, but it is the 3rd. I love the basil eggplant with chicken over rice. I don't know anywhere would make this dish and I'm a fan of basil. The dish is $7.35 walking out the door. 
Would I come again?
Yes, especially when I crave for basil
author: Spike P.

description:
FOOD:
Pretty dang good.  The spicy eggplant, general's chicken, and won ton noodles are very tasty.

SERVICE:
Great service.  Our waitress was very friendly, and our dishes arrived lickety-split.

PRICE
Fairly reasonable.  Our bill averaged out to around $15 per person.
author: Subrosa I.

description:
After moving here from living abroad, various places int he U.S.  and whatever...blah blah, I am really disappointed with the food quality here in SF. So, before I write my review, let me explain this so that hopefully my review will help you make an informed decision on wither you want to order from this place, and ultimately anyplace in SF.

One of the big reasons why I moved back here is that there are tons of restaurants of pretty much anything you could ever want, in pretty close proximity. That is great, but the problem is that it seems like 85% are all kind of blah, the same thing, and not standing out for flavor profiles. Example: I've had 15 different bin mah sandwich's at 15 different places and non of them come close to the one's in Miami from one place (Miss Saigon), same thing with Fried Rice (either Chinese or Japanese) competitive with Denver and Miami (Go To Sushi -Miami- has the best Japanese fried rice that I have had outside of of the Kyoto tower and Osaka). This city is supposed to be Asian food heaven, but so far it has been a constant let down. Kinda like this place.

The good: 
1. They deliver, and they do it till late night with a minimum of $$$ for your order, and pretty quick (ours came in 35min), yay!
2. Proportions are pretty big, yay!, you'll be eating it for a couple of days.
3. Best overall pictures (taken by a person who works there and knows what they are doing..no stupid Instagram camera photo there) so you know what your ordering and what it will look like. 

The bad:
1. Everything is just.....bland, some people are writing that stuff here is yummy, but honestly, I have no idea what they are thinking. Have they been just eating non-big-favor food, were their parents horrible cooks? And, is just eating food is a joyous occasion because everything else in their lives tasted like cold oatmeal, without the flavor packets? Do they want the attention, of blathering on and on just to hear themselves talk (see what I did there...that's irony) I have no idea, but here is what we ordered, and why I was let down (so far have not found ANY Chinese places that are any better for delivery for when I'm particularly lazy):

Thai Ice Tea -- not very sweet (5/10), bitter, not enough condensed milk.

Pot Stickers (6) -- the thickness of the dough was perfect (thick but not a bun), and the filling was pretty good, but they refuse to give you any sauce, Which sucks, because that ginger, soy sauce, garlic green onion stuff is perfect for this, and I'm too lazy to get of my ass and make it, that's why we invented delivery.

Fried Rice -- Had the best pictures for any fried rice that I've ever seen (the guy who took a pic of the entire menu for Yelp did a great job), and was really excited. But, it was the blandest fried rice he's had. It was not the super oily, dark type (it was a short grain kinda fluffy, but you could tell that they were not using the leftover rice from yesterday, which is the secret for great consistently fried rice. But, there was hardly any flavor to it. They used dark meat chicken, did not add green onions, and asked for it spicy (not spicy). Fluffy=good, not tasty=bad.

Fresh Lemonade -- fresh made, semi sweet, perfect amount of sugar vs. bitter. Around 8 oz.

General Tsao's Chicken (Lunch Menu) -- Bland, no flavor, tasted mild spicy level (when ordered spicy), over use of corn starch = disappointment.

Won Ton Soup (Large) -- Wontons where pretty good, but soup base was off, don't know how to explain it, but just didn't really go there like wonton normally does. Got directions correct for no veggies, but disregarded leave green onions.

Shrimp Wonton -- It means meat wonton soup WITH shrimp, not shrimp wonton soup.

Tofu Sweet Corn Soup -- it's eggdrop soup with tofu, corn and egg, not a unique soup.

Fried Crab Meat Rangoon (6) -- Oil has not been filtered (so that you can reuse oil), had a very burnt taste, refuse to give you dipping sauce (red cornstarch based stuff).

Order for 3 people.
author: Max X.

description: My boyfriend and I ordered dinner from Golden Kim Tar for the first time last night and expected tasteless, boring Chinese.  Since living here, we have struggled to find a Chinese delivery joint that we both like.  We were simply thrilled with what we got!  The food arrived in less than 30 minutes and was piping hot.   The fried rice was very yummy and I loved the General Tso's Chicken (extra spicy).  We ended up ordered four different items and thought each was delicious and priced very affordably.  Will certainly be ordering from here again!
author: amanda c.

description: Not a fan of their delivery but a big fan of eating in. Ended up here on christmas eve as a typical SF orphan. Enjoyed plenty of crab & shrimp both of which were amazing. Way to win me back Kim.
author: J A.

description: Went there to eat lunch . I order the tomato Chicken over rice and it was really good . The portion is a lot and it tastes yummy . My husband ordered the Singapore noodles and he can't even finish the whole plate . I will come back again in the future .
author: Isabelle L.

description:
I have absolutely no negative comments for golden Kim Tar...surprising, as I am very very picky about my Chinese food.  I went here because it was right across the street from the Federal Building and I had to go there for an appointment.  So very glad that I did!!!

The decor was very unassuming and I didnt have very high hopes for my meal, but I was knocked in the mouth-hole with one of THE BEST lunches that I have ever had.  I ordered the crispy Hunan fish with fried rice and expected to get a little plate with some soggy fish pieces swimming in sauce and some gummy rice...soooo not what I was served.  The fish was crispy and delicious, the sauce was spicy and garlicky, the veggies (zucchini, onion, tomato, etc) all cooked so that they were tender, yet crisp, and the fried rice was delicious and NOT gummy or overly oily/salty.  The lunch also came with a little bowl of soup and a pot of tea all for the low low price of $7 and some change.  

To top it off, the waitresses and waiter/manager were all extremely quick, attentive and friendly.  

I will definitely be back!!!
author: Rena H.

description: I come for the delicious, reasonably priced food and I've stayed because of the outstanding customer service. No matter how busy the restaurant is, I am always greeted with politeness. Which is not easy to come by in the Tenderloin.
author: Melissa B.

description: Good food. My wife has a severe peanut allergy which we let them know about. She had the Chicken Chow mien and was fine.
author: Lawrence A.

description:
I can't speak for dining in, but I tried several dishes through their delivery.

Overall, their delivery service is fast and efficient. It took only 30 minutes to receive my food after ordering at 12:35 pm, right in the middle of the lunch rush.

The food is mediocre at best. There's nothing wrong with their food presentation, or even cleanliness of the food itself. However, every single dish was bland.

General Tso's Chicken: Looked perfect. Was still crispy. Tasted like flour and bland chicken breast with a slight sweetness. The sauce was very runny.

Crispy Schechuan Beef: Looked perfect. Very crispy. Great meat to veggie ratio. Tasted like oil and a little bit of salt.

Kung Pao Chicken: The worst of the lot. Bland. Slimy. Not much chicken. None of the conventional veggies in Chinese cuisine.

Pork Fried Rice: Looks great. Tastes like white rice with oil mixed in.

Veggie Egg Rolls: Tastes Generic.


I love their service, but the food is subpar compared to other carryouts.
author: Noel J.

description: **only for delivery** I ordered food from here and everything looked like it was made long time ago.  Mongolian beef noodles were just all clumped together, bland and with probably 3 pieces of beef.  Both hot and sour soup and egg flower soup are just watered down bland and too sweet. Honey walnut chicken was probably the best but it was not as crunch as I expected. I would not order from this place again.
author: SeungJin N.

description: Very good food! Enjoyed the egg flower soup and sesame chicken. The service was great too!
author: Brooke V.

description:
When I started working in the San Francisco State Building over five years ago, I didn't know too many places to get lunch until one of my co-workers suggested Golden Kim Tar.  

I have eaten lunch here a few times in the past, but I have never written a review.  At lunch time, this place is pretty, pretty busy, but I have to admit there is this one waitress (and I believe she is the head waitress) who is amazingly fast and very efficient in handling the customers and the take-out orders.  She's great and she is such a valuable asset to Golden Kim Tar...just totally awesome and very hospitable.  I can tell she takes pride in her work and she certainly knows how to keep a customer (such as myself) happy.

I love their scrambled eggs with shrimp over rice.  It's reasonably price and they are definitely generous with the pieces of shrimp (at least 8 or 9 pieces).  I seldom can finish it in one sitting and I know why...my eyes get bigger than my stomach.  Everytime I order from them, it is the scrambled eggs with shrimp over rice.  I know I need to switch up and try other items on the menu besides this and won ton soup.  I guess the next time I will try their Ma Po Tofu rice plate.   

Earlier this afternoon I wanted won ton soup to go.  I placed my order with the head waitress and waited along with other customers who had take out orders.  The wait was a little longer than I expected...boom, it all of suddenly got pretty busy.   People were coming in for lunch.  It looked like wall-to-wall people and I wasn't sure if there were enough tables and chairs available to accommodate them.  Me, I would have been overwhelmed by the scene, but she and her crew of waitresses maintained their cool and pretty much handled everybody.  They worked that room "like a piece of cake" and I didn't care that my won ton soup was sitting on the back burner in the kitchen and I haven't paid for it yet.  I just watched and observed them, and they left me with a good lasting impression.  BTW, how was the won ton soup?  Piping hot and quite delicious with a couple pieces of bok choy and broccoli.  I had to blow on the broth and the won ton to cool it down before slurping it.

Since I had no disappointment from this place, I will return for many more visits.
author: Carol C.

description:
I had low expectations ordering from here, but boy was I pleasantly surprised.  My regular go to chinese delivery (Big Lantern) was closed for renovations and I needed lunch delivery that would cover my dinner as well.  Found GKT on Yelp and decided to try ordering through http://Eat24hours.com.

I expected it to take 45min, but the food came very fast under 30minutes.  The soups were lukewarm and the singaporean noodles were not that hot, but I feel like that's expected for cheap chinese delivery. Anyway the portions were huge, I'm on my 4th meal.  They also use biodegradable boxes instead of plastic- great for the environment and for reheating.  The meat in the dishes were large not too fatty pieces that fit the category real meat and not mystery meat- BONUS.

I think I just found a new Chinese delivery place. So long Big Lantern!!!
author: Skye W.

description: I got delivery from here tonight for the second time and I really like it.  Good value, tasty, good delivery time.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
No frills Chinese food, easy to order your delivery online with Eat24 website, my order estimate time was 45 minutes but the food arrived in less than 30 minutes. I have not visited the restaurant but I will definitely order delivery again.

Worst name ever for a restaurant, Golden Kim Tar sounds like a rare Amazonian monkey species or a disease.
author: Shannon Z.

description:
I ordered delivery from here a few times. I've had horrible experiences with delivery overall since moving to SF, and this was one of the bright spots. 

The General Tso's chicken is excellent and there's so much of it I always have leftovers. Whenever it arrives it's really hot and crispy. I've never gotten crispy delivery from Chinese food delivery ever, so that alone is really great. It's also one of the very, very, few places I've encountered that can actually deliver hot food to my apartment for some reason. I have no idea why that is, it's in the middle of the city and not hard to get to. The delivery guy was always super nice and friendly, too. My only gripe about this place is that I wish their minimum delivery price was lower - I can't meet the minimum by myself.
author: Christy S.

description: Stumbled into here by accident.  The portions are huge, the food is very inexpensive and tastes pretty good.  The chow mein wasn't great but everything else was delicious. The man who works there is very accommodating and friendly and even says goodbye at the door when you leave.  This is instantly my favorite Chinese restaurant in SF.  There are not many like this anymore....a real hidden treasure!  I'm a Chinese food lover again.
author: chauncey h.

description:
Really disappointing.
I was so sad because I was expecting something good.
On a slow Sunday, it took them 40 minutes to prepare 3 dishes for myself and 3 kids.
A not fun experience.
author: Jessica F.

description:
I normally don't give 5 stars for solely great service, but this is a tale that deserves to be told and warrants 5 stars simply because of how unbelievable it sounds. 

My roommate and I stopped by here one day after work, initially under the assumption that we were at Burmese Kitchen, the restaurant next door we saw the previous day and wanted to try. It turned out that wasn't the case, but it was a little too late to change our minds as the lady manning the cashier ushered us in and showed us to our table. 

When she came to take our order, my roommate decided (I'm still not sure whether it was out of ignorance or a fervent desire for the extraordinary) on a whim that he wanted Burmese food, and so he asked if they serve this famous Burmese noodle soup. 

The lady went inside the kitchen to consult with the chef, who actually came out and asked my roommate how the dish was prepared. Ten minutes later he came out with what looked to be a Burmese dish and said, "Give it a try, see if you like it." What kind of altruistic, people-pleasing chef is this? Do they even exist? 

Rubbing my eyes, I tried the dish with my roommate and it was a damn good imitation of the real dish (which I found out the day after when we actually went to Burmese Kitchen). My roommate agreed.

When the check came, it was only for my meal, a rice plate that was pretty darn good as well. We asked the lady why we weren't charged for the Burmese noodle soup, and the chef came out and said, "Well, it wasn't on the menu, and I wasn't sure if you'll like it, so no charge. Just come back next time and I'll make something else for you."

I was in awe of the display of kindness and business ethics this guy has shown us. We left a $12 tip and became a regular at this restaurant ever since, partly because the Chinese food here is authentic and quick, and also partly because the chef has restored my faith in humanity.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
I don't write a lot of reviews, but Yelp is where I discovered Golden Kim Tar.

So I was craving food and feeling super lazy... so naturally getting an excessive amount of food delivered was what I was looking for. Golden Kim Tar was one of the establishments that had a lot of positive reviews and a website where I could order online (super lazy...).

Ordered the General Tsao's Chicken, Steamed Rice, Fried Crab Meat Rangoon, and Fresh Lemonade.

Chicken was crispy and fresh which was awesome. The rangoon was solid and the lemonade was fresh as well. 

I think the best thing was that they arrived 20 minutes after I ordered. I will definitely order from here again.
author: David B.

description:
Best Chinese food I've found in the Loin by far!!  I've been coming to this place and ordering delivery for years.  Fast service, fast delivery.  Wish they delivered after 9:30pm though.  We always order through eat24hours.com.

After working in Chinatown for 6 years I don't have high expectations from any Chinese restaurant in San Francisco but this one definitely stands out for very solid, tasty food.  Plus the people who run it are so really nice and actually smile at you!  And they have deals...like order $20 worth of food and they throw in free egg rolls.  Not the tiny egg rolls, 3 very good sized crispy egg rolls!  If you order $30 or $50 worth, the free swag gets better.  

The lunch specials, however, are the greatest deal here.  For around $8 including tax and tip, you get a pot of tea, soup, a rice plate with many choices of entree (or if you ask very nicely for something else not included on the lunch menu they will usually do it for you for a little more $) AND the obligatory fortune cookie and orange wedge.

Every time they are closed and I order from somewhere else in the 'hood I'm always disappointed by the comparison.  Favorites are General Tsao's Chicken, Egg Flower Soup, Ma Po Tofu with Pork, Salt & Pepper String Beans with Tofu, Beef & Black Bean Sauce Chow Fun (order extra sauce tho...) and Yang Chow Fried Rice.
author: Jon B.

description:
Ordered the black bean chicken with asparagus, and beef chow fun with black bean sauce, and rice.

I live downtown, delivery was relatively quick for a Sunday at 1.

Very large portions. Chicken and asparagus was cooked perfectly. Beef chow fun was what was to be expected. Will try other stuff there again!
author: dutchy s.

description:
My favorite tenderloin chinese food.  Vegetarian friendly.  Their meatless stuff is good! 

Delivery is good, too.
author: Yumi N.

description: I wasn't impressed.  Ordered delivery, it came in good time, but the food was sub-par compared to other delivery I've had.
author: Allegra Z.

description: Awful. Used to love them but have gone way way downhill .. Like nasty downhill. Food was extremely bland, seemed old and just bad. Stay away!!!
author: chad l.

description:
DELICIOUS... and come on... not only was street parking EASY and FREE on a FRIDAY night, but the street was well populated so no dark alleyway issues! 

The food was better than expected and the prices were AMAZING! We were a group of 7 women, some had beer with dinner and out bill came to only $70 and change! Stacy was very helpful, had a great sense of humor and well spoken. The General Chicken was delicious and all the dishes were nicely prepared, meet was tender, enough sauce for flavor and just enough so the veggies stayed tender without getting mushy and the crunchy ingredients were actually still crunchy!  The hot tea was lovely, it had a beautiful soft floral scent and a nice taste. 

I am going back again with my girl friends cause you cannot beat the food or the price!
author: Toni M.

description: Even though this place makes me want to sleep after I eat their food, it's amazing. Orange chicken is great and they give huge portions. Also made me shit my pants one time, but no biggie. I wonder if they do birthday parties.
author: Andrew G.

description:
I had read some good reviews about Golden Kim Tar and figured I'd give em a shot for delivery.  Overall, I was very satisfied!

We ordered the Sizzling Rice Soup, Mongolian Beef, Potstickers and brown rice.  The soup was seasoned well and gave the chicken and veggies a nice kick without overpowering their natural flavors- I hate when places completely disguise the taste of what I'm eating!  Same for the Mongolian Beef- it wasn't soaked in sauce and was really good!  Beware though, if you're not an onion fan you're in for a plate full of onions when you order the Mongolian Beef here...  Luckily, I am, so kudos to you Golden Kim Tar!  I probably would have been better off not ordering the potstickers though... These are baked here instead of fried and has a really soft rubbery texture to the outside of em- it just didn't work for me... everything else was fantastic though and I'll definitely have to try Golden Kim Tar again!
author: Bobby P.

description:
I come here for lunch sometimes with my coworker because it is fast and cheap. They always have lunch special, but it gets very crowded during lunch. They have added more items to their lunch special menu now. When you order the lunch special, it always comes with soup. I like their Mongolian beef and black pepper beef, although there is always a lot more veggie than beef. Their sweet and sour chicken was mediocre; there was a lot of breading and some pieces tasted soggy instead of crispy. I would choose the orange chicken over the sweet and sour chicken, at least it was more flavorful. You get a slice of orange with a fortune cookie at the end of each meal. 

Oh, and it gets quite stuffy if you sit in the back near the kitchen area.
author: Mimi K.

description: I've walked by this place for years without noticing it.  Finally, at the invitation of a friend, I dined at Golden Kim Tar on April 26th, 2013.  I was pleasantly surprised.  While the decor was simple and unassuming, the food was good and the service was warm and comforting.   With good portions and reasonable prices I recommend it.
author: David L.

description:
I don't freaking effing care what any of you Yelpers have to say about this place.
I have MAD MAD RESPECT for the delivery guy. He braved the freaking storm last friday (1/4/08) to deliver the breakfast order for my office.
