Normally when we order delivery, they make us come outside the building and pick it up from their car. Not the delivery guy here!! He comes all the way to our office!! THANK YOU GOLDEN KIM TAR DELIVERY GUY!!

$4 breakfast which consisted of 2 eggs any style (sunnyside up always for me!), hash browns, choice of french fries or 2 pieces of toast (toast for me!) and FOUR PIECES OF BACON!!

*falls over*

They were also NOT shady with the condiments. 
OMG OMG OMG I was so hungry, I could've hugged and kissed the delivery guy when he came. Okay not really, but even though he was late he was EXTREMELY apologetic about it. Their ceiling got damaged from the storm and he had to try to fix the leak =( 
I really hope their restaurant did okay through the storm, the delivery guy was so nice.

Ok I can't believe I wrote a review about a freaking delivery guy...

But anyway! The portions for my breakfast were HUGE!!! And only $3.95!!! AND THEY DELIVER!!

WTF!!

I LOVE YOU GOLDEN KIM TAR!!!!!!!!!!


CAN I USE ANYMORE EXCLAMATION MARKS!??!?! !!!!!!!!!

!!!!!!!!!!!
!!!!!!
!
!
!!
!
!

!
!
author: Susy C.

description:
As a visitor to San Francisco, I used Yelp to find a good chinese restaurant with delivery. Well, I was not steered wrong! The delivery took about 30 minutes and the food arrived hot and in perfect condition. 

The vegteable egg rolls were crispy on the outside and delicious on the inside. The chicken fried rice was loaded with chicken and had great flavor. 

I ordered the mongolian beef "medium hot" and guess what? They nailed it - not too hot and not too mild. I am here three nights and I will probably order from here again.

Recommended!
author: Mike N.

description:
It's not the BEST Chinese food EVER but it's definitely a legitimate place for Chinese food. I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for good tasting, cheap, and generously portioned Chinese food in the area!

-Price and Portions: Cheap and large portions  

-Service: The service is the best part.  It's a family owned business and they are the nicest people ever. 

-Hours and Delivery: open late and deliver

-Recommendations: General Tsao's Chicken, Broccoli Beef, Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings, Roast Duck, House Fried Rice
author: Angela F.

description: A cheap Chinese takeout place. The service was okay, and the food pretty solid. Quality to price is pretty good. Definitely a nice place to break around Civic Center. North of Golden Kim Tar, however, is a bit sketchy.
author: Michael C.

description:
Every affordable Chinese restaurant I've eaten in my life had the same run of the mill, greasy taste- so much so that I stopped eating in these places for good. That's until my co-worker took me to this place for lunch.
Good good tasty food! I was seriously surprised! Delicious and well made. 
Check out the place, you won't be disappointed.
author: Blue C.

description:
I initially wasn't feeling it, especially when the lady taking my order kept repeating "so you want no flavor" in response to my request for the shrimp and mango dish to be steamed. Sometimes the tone is a welcome confirmation, other times, like today, it's borderline mocking. I wasn't amused.

The price was also a bit steep. $10 is higher than most, and it was going to take a pretty generous serving to save this from a lukewarm two star yelp.

But all the negativity was soon swept away. My food came steamed (fine, mock me as long as you'll do it), there were some unexpected veggies mixed in, the cost included some rice that went to someone in need down the street, and the portion was almost enough for two meals.

Two stars leapfrogged three to become four. I'm totally a fan.
author: Jason B.

description: Good price for a lot of food if you going to have lunch there get there before 12 noon a lot of businessmen and women go there Monday to Friday for lunch every day and it's a madhouse so get there before noon and enjoy
author: Travis A.

description:
Good chinese food for a reasonable price!
we had crispy chicken, Han-nan beef, and pork fried rice for two.
Crispy chicken was just a little over cooked.
There is no sesame chicken here, which I was the most wanted to eat :-(
author: Yas K.

description:
I've had food from here on two different occasions.  Both of them inappropriate.  Just kidding!  

The first time I was here, I wanted something soup-like, but I didn't want to dine-in which is the only way to enjoy pho.  That meant I couldn't eat at half of the places within a 2 block radius.  And I didn't want a sandwich.  That left only chinese food.  I've been wary about chinese food because I'm chinese.  And most Americanized chinese places are equivalent to mom-and-pop greasy spoons.  It's not exactly what mother used to make.  

When I came in, I started scoping out what everyone else was eating.  The thing that looked oh-so-tasty and lip-smacking delicious was the soups.  Wonton soups.  Some had seafood, some did not.  I wanted some clear broth with that nice aromatic quality, no MSG and some plump juicy wontons.  

Luckily, on the specials board (I wonder if the specials ever change?), there was a writing on the wall: Combination war wonton soup.  $5.99.  Why the heck not?  10 mins later and $6.50 later, I had in a plastic container some beautiful looking wontons in clear but robust sauce.  I hurried back to the office, threw my stuff all over Tyron's desk and started killing the wontons.  The sliced meat/shrimp in the broth was delicate.  More delicate than the mongolian beef i just ate from this place.  The wontons were generous and the skin was just the right thickness.  Noodle-like but not doughy.

Today, I ordered the mongolian beef.  It was spicy!  It had a lot of beef, and sugar.  I think it was too sweet, and the beef was not as tender as in the soup.  But they sure gave me a whole lot of it!  I'll be eating that for lunch for the next few days, that's for sure.  

In the future, I'll stick with the wonton soup.  There was also enough to last two meals.  And I really love soup.
author: Christina C.

description: I love the asparagus salmon lunch special. The portions are very generous. The fried rice is so fluffy and soft and fresh. The salmon is always cooked perfectly. And the asparagus. oh my god. the asparagus is the best i have ever eaten in my life. It is tender and yet crisp at the same time, and meaty. the sauce complements both the salmon and the asparagus and ties the dish together. One top of that, before the meal arrives you get egg drop soup (which i normally hate) which you will crave for days. I can't believe that this place exists, let alone in the middle of the tenderloin.
author: Faith G.

description:
Honey Walnut prawns were definitely sub-par from other places that I've been to, let alone what I could make at home. Not even served with lettuce - just these weird sweet and sour crisps - and only like 5 walnuts with wayyyy too much mayonnaise in the sauce and way too much corn starch in the batter.

Chow mein was good though. Delivery time faster that the 45 min maximum so that was nice. Overall average place.
author: Chloe W.

description: I've ordered from this place a lot in the past and the last few orders have been disappointing. Both my last orders have been late. This last time they didn't even bring me the correct order. The woman on the phone was very nice. Then the delivery guy tried to get me to keep what he gave me instead of what I ordered since it was more expensive. The problem was I didn't like what he brought me and ordered what I did for a reason.  So I called the woman back and the correct order is supposedly on its way. I will update this post when/if the correct order arrives. Stay tuned!
author: Amanda W.

description: Eat24 had them as the best choice for Chinese, I couldn't disagree more!  The food took more than 1:15 to arrive and was cold on arrival.  The fried rice was soaked in oil and unpalatable. The sweet and sour chicken had bones and tendons in every other bite. The list goes on and on. When Eat24 launched I had wonderful luck nth now more than a year after I first used it I've had two horrible back to back experiences and I've deleted the app from my phone.
author: reed k.

description:
Good food. I wanted the lunch beef chow fun but even though it was listed under the heading ("served with soup AND rice"), the guy told me no rice comes with the chow fun (I wanted white rice, too, but he was having none of it). Oh, well. I wanted rice so I went with garlic chicken. Good sized portions, not very spicy (probably medium spiciness), cheap ($6 before tip for my meal and hot tea), and very fast service. I'll be back. 

On a side note, whoever write the fortune in my cookie did not have kids: "Keep in mind that it's the journey and not the destination that counts."
author: Dave J.

description: I visited here one hungover afternoon. After ordering the Beef Stew egg noodle soup, I began to re-cap the events of the previous night. Just a big smile from me.... Anyways, the lady owner is very nice and invited me to sit down. Once the food came out, I was surprised by the abundance of bok choy and meat. Despite the soup being very bland, I just added the chili sauce from my condiment station and it was fine. I would gladly return to try their other dishes, but I believe the soup needs more flavor please!
author: Thomas L.

description: Had the General Tso's chicken and potstickers.  They were excellent.  I got it to go and it was very fast.  Service was good.  Would order here again if I were in the neighborhood.
author: Dave C.

description:
Simple version: Ordered for delivery, the food arrived an hour late and nearly cold. Rude phone service. The salt and pepper calamari was adequate but also greasier than I've had elsewhere. 

Long version: Filling in the blanks here from the simple version, I decided to order lunch for myself and my flu-stricken boyfriend at around 10:30a before his 1p work shift. Hopped onto GrubHub and selected Golden Kim Tar based on its being recommended by fellow users of the site, as well as by users here. Ordered the salt and pepper calamari, Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce, won ton soup, and a small side of white rice to go along with some brown rice I had yet to prepare. Done and done by 10:50a, with an email order confirmation stating an estimated arrival time of 11:35a. Perfect, more than enough time to have a meal before having to send off the working man.

11:40 comes around and no food, so I decided to call the restaurant to ensure delivery was imminent. I suppose rude isn't quite the correct word to employ here, though the call did end abruptly after she hung up on me. Maybe the right word would be... unprofessional? That's rather harsh, but the exchange went something like: 

Me: I ordered four dishes online that have yet to arrive, I just want to confirm they're on the way.
Her: Yes, give it, like, 15 or 20 minutes. 
Me: 15 or 20 minutes? I ordered the food nearly an hour ago.
Her: No no, the food is already on the way there, I said 15 to 20 minutes so you wouldn't get angry. 
Me: Sorry? Um, so it'll be here very soon, right?
Her: Yes, it's on its way *click*

Something about that rubbed me the wrong way, and I waited for the food impatiently pacing, and maybe fuming. Given this, maybe I wasn't in the proper state to be judging their menu, especially since it was my first time experiencing theirs and it was food delivered. I will say that the food did arrive but not until 12:05p and that the rice was dry and cool, and the calamari was barely adequate and also cool. The Chinese broccoli was tasty, but I've hardly ever experienced a bad iteration of the dish. All of the dishes sat atop paper doilies that separated it from shredded lettuce, which was considerate but also a little odd. Nothing that screamed either authenticity or any consideration for aesthetics, though, again, this is a delivery order. 

I'd only go back for Golden Kim Tar if I were going to be eating at the restaurant itself, but don't imagine wanting to with other places like Tú Lan or even Thèm Ky around in relative proximity.
author: Jake m.

description: My friend and I went to San Francisco for spring break.  Golden Kim Tar was the closest chinese restaurant nearest to the hotel that we were staying at.  We felt all day for chinese food.  While, we were there, it was late at night and it was quite and calm.  We were greeted politely and were service, the service wasn't the best, but it was okay.  It took waiter awhile to take our order and we had to wait for our food as well.  Their food wasn't that great compare to the chinese restaurant here at Portland, OR.  So I decided to give it a three star.
author: Young Y.

description: Golden KIm Tar has the best delivery Chinese I've ever had.  I've never eaten in the restaurant but I think they're more of a delivery operation.  I love the way that they pack their food for travel.  Fried food is packed in these crispy rice things that absorb excess oil and keep things crispy until delivery.  They're awesome.
author: Joseph C.

description:
The rice is really really bad.... Like it makes the rest of the food pretty terrible. The appetizers are subar at best. 

Honestly, except for some tangy sauce they added to my rice, the rest of the food was pretty crappy. The company ordered in and nobody seemed to like anything.
author: Rohan D.

description: 5stars in the category of good, fast and cheap in the Tenderloin. Lunch crowd from civic center makes for busy mid day, but never a wait for a table. Occasionally a bit of a language problem with helpers, but "boss" always smiles and understands special orders without mistakes. Food comes quickly and portions are generous. I gladly go there when in the neighborhood. Today we had tofu and veggie , shrimp; chicken with black bean sauce. All yummy.
author: Howard S.

description:
Rough experience last night. Delivery factor was nice and all, but the food left me wishing I never went on that Breaking Bad binge. 

The Walnut prawns were pretty bomb, though. Two stars!
author: B B.

description: I came here for lunch a few times when I worked down the street, and I saw it as a tolerably good greasy, cheap Chinese food joint. All that changed the day I ordered a combination fried rice to go, rode my bike all the way to the marina with it, and then opened the box to discover a short, curly hair (you know what kind I mean)  perched on top of the mound of rice like a cherry on a sundae... In a horror movie. Needless to say, I have never visited Golden Kim Tar again, but I suppose I should take this opportunity to thank them for a good story.
author: Kristina B.

description: This place has great prices and the people are always really nice.  I've been several times and I've never been disappointed.  It's not fancy or anything, but you don't eat the decor.
author: Hassan A.

description: Ordered take out from eat24- came on time, easy order, delicious food. We had pea sprouts, mongolian beef, garlic basil lemongrass noodles and BBQ pork chow mein, yum. Dumplings were meh. Will definitely get take out here again.
author: Inna L.

description: Ok despite my urge to ban this place... I went once more... giving them a 2nd chance... this time I ordered a beef rice plate... and this time it was ok in flavor but the rice was too soggy... I'll pass on Kim Tar from now on.
author: Stephen Y.

description: Got takeout from here cause I just moved to this area and it was very...blah. Imagine a no name Chinese place in a mall and that's what this tastes like. I mean Panda Express has more flavor than this. MSG to the max, not a whole lot of flavor, and actually made me depressed about my night. Why depressed? The worst hot and sour soup I've ever tasted on a night that I was craving it. Oh well like Jay-Z says, on to the next one.
author: Chris D.

description:
Try to surpass the decor because it won't matter... the restaurant sign looks like it dates back from the Nixon era, 80s wood panel wall paper, cracked linoleum flooring, and some really hazardous chairs & tables that look like you can fall on your ass when you're seated

Why?

Lunch rocks at Kim Tar...but that all depends

My recommendations are:

Salt & Pepper Chicken wings w/ combo fried rice are delicious. I love that the chicken comes out golden brown yet the meat is juicy & tender

Honey Walnut prawns are big & sweet

Salted Fish & Chicken rice is addicting....they serve it on a big plate of heaps that resemeble a mountain

Suggestions for Improvement:

Mu Shu Chicken was salty as hell...it may have sent my blood pressure through the roof. Kim Tar needs to ease up on the salt for this dish

Overall, Kim Tar satisfies the "comfort food urge"

Speaking from experience, it's the place to go on Monday & cure the weekend hangover...woot
author: Charmian D.

description:
I finally had to make an account so that I could review this place.  I've just ordered the Five Flavor Chicken for about the 452nd time and keep telling my friends how good it is.

If you're not a fan of Crispy Noodles, just ask for "chicken on the top, rice on the bottom".  The only problem is, they'll think you're me.  Because they always remember us and once when we didn't order for, like a month, the delivery guy said to us with a smile "hey, been a while - where have you been eating???"

I swear it's laced with crack or something.  Every time we have friends over we get this just so they can take a bite and go "wow, that is GOOD chicken."

We also like:
Crab rangoon
Crispy beef
Beef and black mushrooms
Mongolian beef
author: Marsha S.

description: I have a pretty high tolerance for bad Chinese food but I got delivery from here and it was just junk.  Crappy processed tasteless general tso chicken, tough stringy gross beef... I mostly just avoided the meat and ate the soggy broccoli.  Threw out most of the $30 of food I bought.  Order from somewhere else.  I rarely post reviews but felt the 3 1/2 stars this place has are totally unwarranted.
author: Kevin F.

description:
This is probably the most mediocre american style chinese food I have ever had. Panda Express is gourmet compared to this place. I ordered crab cheese wontons, Generals chicken, mongolian beef, and schezwan style egglplant. 

The Wontons were not crispy, and in fact were quite rubbery. The Generals chicken had more breading than chicken and was not very flavorful, the mongolian beef was grey in appearance and mushy in texture (to the point where I wonder if its not beef), and the egglplant dish smelled like body odor. Pretty gross. The only redeeming item was a free hot/sour soup wthat was actually very delicious. 

I will not be ordering from here again.
author: Ryan K.

description:
I've been to Golden Kim Tar a few times for lunch and recommend it for anyone who works in the area.  The lunch specials are pretty cheap and you get a ton of food: big portion of your selected entree, rice, soup and an egg roll.  Service is very friendly and the food comes out pretty quick.

I think the menu presents a good variety of Americanized Chinese food, which is fine by me.  So far my favorite is the Mandarin Spicy Eggplant with Shrimp & Chicken.
author: Joseph N.

description: Surprisingly wouldn't think the food would be good at this tenderloin spot but it is actually very decent Chinese food!  Lunch specials are a bargain!  I usually order off menu and they accommodate. Service is also good here!  My favorite. Scrambled Egg beed or shrimp over rice!
author: King L.

description: We ordered Sunday dinner for delivery. The food arrived in a descent time. The food was average. Not that much different than other delivery Chinese food. The portion though is bigger than other Chinese restaurant (Big Lantern for example) - which is good. I wish I had known that before ordering so we don't have leftovers.
author: Sally L.

description: I ordered for the first time this week, after searching for Chinese restaurants that had catering/party sizes for a work party. A nearby restaurant we order from occasionally did have party size trays, but they were pretty expensive and had an extremely limited selection - maybe 5-6 main dish options. They also did not deliver the party sizes. I began searching through Eat 24, looked at a few places and then found Golden Kim Tar. Their selection is tremendous (pretty much any main dish item you would get on the menu was available in party size, as far as I could tell) and prices are very competitive for the 5 lb. party trays of food. I planned on ordering through Eat 24, but called to make sure they delivered to our address, and to see how far in advance they needed my order. I ended up placing the order on the phone (which cost me the 5% rebate or whatever from Eat 24) because the employee who answered said I needed to place it immediately. Anyway, communications were not the most clear, but the delivery came within the time frame I'd requested and the food was really, really good! We kept it pretty basic (sweet and sour pork and chicken fried rice, General Tso's chicken, house special egg rolls and combination chow mein) but everything tasted great and the rice and chow mein had the biggest chunks of meats I've ever seen. Really delicious. I will say that there was more than enough food, more than we ever needed, which made for some great take home and next day leftovers at work. In future, though, I would probably opt for getting several regular size containers of different menu selections. In any event, I'll definitely order again.
author: Barbara E.

description: Great restaurant.  I found this on the phone while looking for Chinese restaurants near BART stations to stop in with my family, who had just come in from NY for graduation.  here's my google review: Wish we'd gotten the beers and soup before the food, but it was really great and filling. Had the combo fried rice, combo wanton soup, cashew broccoli chicken, mango beef, and shrimp with lobster sauce. Very clean restroom also. Go!  Liked: Lots of great food, friendly staff
author: Taràs C.

description: Whoever said this place was authentic must have never had real Chinese food. Anyway, I like that they have good service, fast delivery and are reliable on a late night. Unfortunately I have been disappointed both times by the food, which tends to the bland and oily. Their meatless chicken is good enough, but stick with the American-Chinese staples if you like that kind of thing (I can't eat it). Sweet and sour is the blandest and oiliest I've had and I don't think they read the delivery instructions if you order online.
author: Kit A.

description:
I like this place, and their food is definitely well priced, although some of the plates we have ordered there can be bland. Cannot say that I would recommend the Mu Shu pork, but then again, can't have perfect dish for everyone, huh.

So we have stuck with vegetable hot and sour soup (really good), mongolian beef and lemon chicken. Never been disappointed with those, and when we pick up, they bring us a pot of tea while we wait, so it's nice.
author: Yelena K.

description: Not only did the website say that the estimated delivery time was 75 minutes, but we actually called the restaurant to find out how long it would be (they said "over an hour" - so I guess technically, they were right).  2 and a half hours later the cold, sad, flavorless, deep-fried, not-seasoned food showed up.  Don't order from this restaurant.  Bad service, bad food, seriously long delivery time with NO communication.
author: Annette G.

description:
I'm hella pissed right now...so my mom ordered black peppered ribs...with NOT TOO MUCH PEPPER, salt & pepper fried chicken, and egg rolls. 

I was looking forward in eating some black peppered ribs...u know what they did they gave us FRIED ribs instead...thats why im so pissed right now...the chef better read carefully and LISTEN carefully...and so tonight im having ALL FRIED FOOD 4 Dinner -- that PISSES ME OFF! shit! This is a warning, if they do this again next time...I AM NOT GOING BACK!!!
author: Jennifer B.

description: There was a change of owners a few years back and what a huge difference. The Malaysian Chow Fun is epic!  You can get better Chinese food out there but this is a great bang for the buck.
author: Peter F.

description: Really good food. Crab rangoons are a must.  Excellent service too. I've had delivery here in less than 20 mins. Solid recommend from me!
author: AJ V.

description: We had vegetable fried rice, General Tso's chicken, and pot stickers. Everything was excellent and tasted very fresh, especially the chicken. We didn't even come close to eating everything, the portions were so big. The staff were exceptionally hospitable and our waiter personally boxed all of our considerable leftovers for us.
author: Joe G.

description:
Food is ok, not that great. 

This comment is mostly about he quality of service. I asked for Chwo Mein without mushrooms, and it had mushrooms (for one of m pick-up orders). Another day, I order the lunch combo special which is supposed to include egg rolls, but they didn't include because they said I ordered it online, only if I order in the restaurant do they have the egg rolls.  Another time, I order a combo with an entree and chow mein, and they forget the chow mein and put in rice....

Inconsistent service and they have a frequent tendency to get orders wrong! There are better places to go where they don'g get the orders wrong and provide consistent service. 

Bad experiences here....
author: M s.

description: Food was delicious but I wasn't happy that the Peking Duck serving size was embarrassingly small. I ordered delivery via Eat24 service, and won't order from this restaurant again
author: Craig L.

description: You look at the clock.... 2:30 and you have yet to order lunch for the office. Well, this place delivers! Yummy food in less than 45mins. Great prices, great service! The driver walks up 45steps just so I don't have to come down to meet him. Overall I love this place.
author: Jocelyn A.

description: I ordered the House Special Chicken Soup. After over an hour wait, the delivery guy brought my food, but not like I was expecting. One container was full of scalding broth. The other container was packed tight with everything else - chicken, noodles, etc. The smell coming from the box with the chicken and noodles was so unappetizing I threw everything away. When I order soup, I expect soup, not a DIY project.
author: Ted S.

description:
YAY! I'M A FAN because:

1. Golden Kim Tar delivers within the Tenderloin/Civic Center area for FREE!

2.  The portions are HUMONGOUS!

3. Supercheap! $20 worth of food consists of 2 huge full entrees, an appetizer and a free chowmein or fried rice which can feed 3- 4 people.

4.  The dishes are actually yummy.  Not yummy as in "I'll brave the TL to get to this food" yummy but as long as I work around the area, I'll eat here. So far, I've had the Sesame Chicken, Orange Chicken, Beef with Black Mushroom, Kung Pao Tofu (my fave so far), etc.  They are all delicious!!! 

For the first time last week I tried their delivery service.  I phoned in my order and they delivered the food to my office punctually as I requested.

I was ecstatic!  It means that I can have Chinese Food Nights with boyfriend for cheap and just a phonecall away!

The restaurant itself is non-descript but the servers were very friendly.

Tip:  If you are visiting the beautiful San Francisco Main Library (SFPL), you can ask Golden Kim Tar to deliver your food to  the library. Just don't eat your food at SFPL.  NO EATING/DRINKING ALLOWED AT THE LIBRARY!

Enjoy!
author: Leah E.

description:
It was pretty good for what we got. Apparently I was suppose to get the chicken wings, which I didn't know about. My mom and I stumbled in when we were hungry one day. We had the sizzling tofu with vegetables, which was really good and the seafood soup, which was pretty bland. 

They have delivery though, so I'll definitely order from them again.
author: Katrina S.

description: My favorite food at this restaurant is Mongolian Beef with fried rice. that's so awesome.
author: Benny B.

description:
This review is largely based on my most recent visit on a Tuesday evening.

Overall: 2.25/5
Food is definitely edible but some plates need more flavor. Beware the rice!

Decor: 0.5
Pretty spacious. Glass-covered tables. TV playing movies for your pleasure.

Food: 0.5 x 2
Maybe I'm too Americanized when it comes to food, but the General Tso chicken is good. It's not too spicy or salty. For $6.25 (lunch price also available at dinner), it comes out really hot and steamy along with a huge wad of steamy rice even bigger than the pile of breaded and glazed chicken.

However, the other saucy dishes are quite bland. Besides General Tso, which has a dark brown color, dishes using the light brownish sauce is really tasteless. Examples: the calamary that comes with twenty times the vegetables ($7.90), garlic chicken that doesn't even taste like garlic and has two times the vegetables ($6.25).

Price: 0.5
Lunch menu is a pretty good deal, starting at $6.25. If you get there before 2 PM, you get a soup with it. I don't recommend anything else based on price and quantity of meat. There are a lot of dishes using veggies as filler.

Service: 0.25
This subscore is based on my most recent visit. This would have been 0 were it not for the husband owner offering an extra plate so I could share my friend's dish. Other than that, the wife owner doesn't seem very happy. I'm pretty sure she can speak English, but she barely says anything or listens to our requests correctly. For example, we asked for separate checks, but we got a single check anyway. We asked for boxes to go, but instead of bringing them to us, she took only my plate (my friend's plate just had rice she wanted to take for later use). I saved quite a lot in order to have some for the next meal, but I'm suspicious of the amount actually put into the small box I got in return. In addition, I realized later that she didn't even include a significant amount of food in my to-go set. More specifically, it looks like I got maybe 6-8 piece of chicken out of maybe 15-20 that I saved. Don't even get me started on the pitiful amount of rice dropped to the bottom of the box. Considering this with her not initially taking my friend's rice (perhaps for later use?  a wild speculation) makes me suspect that they REUSE THE RICE AND FOOD. Not giving me the food I paid for and possibly reusing that stuff is not acceptable. So if you want to take your food to go, insist that you do it yourself. I certainly will, if I ever go back.

On other days, service is quite slow and unattentive, so this subscore would have gotten at most 0.25 anyway.
author: Brian H.

description: I have lived in the neighborhood since 1997 and have eaten here a few time over the years. I have to say that it is still a great place to get cheap, quick and good Chinese food! The people that work here are friendly. When I have placed an order to go they get it out to you fast. I can't think of anything bad to say about the food as I have ordered lots of their selections from the menu and have always enjoyed it!
author: Mike R.

description: I have been ordering from Golden Kim Tar since I moved into the Mission and discovered Eat24hours.com. They are absolutely accommodating on my orders whenever I ask for a vegetarian alternative to items that are listed with only meat/poultry options. For instance, I love the Thai Curry Noodle dish that is listed on the menu with chicken. With my need to know where my meat, poultry and fish come from, I assume that there is just no way that they could make the dish that they do at the price they do unless their meat is from indutrial farms, so I usually opt for a "vegetarian" option, that is not listed. When I make the request, they create a lovely alternative vegge dish. So, I thank them for that. Their food has the right amount of spice and quite flavorful.
author: Genie H.

description: I have been a steady customer for the past 10 years. Over all, the food arrives fast AND hot! In that time, Ive only sent back food: ONCE! It was the Sweet & Sour Pork. The meat was HARD and stale. OK, Once in 10 years, Meh. But, tonight, I was flabbergasted! I ordered the Sweet & Sour Pork. I asked them to MAKE SURE it was fresh. It was AWFUL. The peppers were OLD w/ Spots on them from rot. The meat was hard and STALE!! I called. I was POLITE. She Y-E-L-L-E-D @ me: "YOU NOT GO WASTE FOOD!!" "HE ALREADY BRING TO YOU!!" "NO WASTE THE FOOD!" "BIG ORDER!" "YOU EAT!!"  Um, REALLY? After 10 years, I'm NEVER going back. Sad. TERRIBLE way to treat a LOYAL customer!!
author: Sabrina R.

description:
So of course I used Yelp to find a new chinese restaurant to try out and Golden Kim Tar came up with the highest average rating which I think is pretty much dead on.

The lady on the phone was amazingly hilarious. She seemed super excited to take my order and she called back to verify my card number and apologized and asked me how many people were eating and I said 3 people  thinkin thats how many chop sticks she'll throw in and such....and then asked what my fav soda was and I said Root Beer and here comes the delivery 30 minutes later with 3 free sodas! AMAZING! LoL! ( i get excited over free things lol ) The dude was super nice that delivered and had a huge smile on his face and thanked me and closed my door for me....

So yes...food....

I ordered the Orange Chicken,General Tso, and Pineapple Fried Rice....

You really cant go wrong with the orange chicken or general tso, great portions and I got plenty of left over for lunch and dinner even after two of my other friends dug in.
The pineapple friend rice is better then most that i've had...it has a nice curry taste to it and pineapples seem freshly cut and its a huge portion for 6 bucks. 

So far, my go to chinese joint till they mess up. LoL!
author: Charlie D.

description: I have found two more dishes I'm totally in love with from this restaurant, Bitter Melon Chicken with black bean sauce with steamed rice and BItter Melon Beef with black bean sauce and steamed rice. Bitter Melon is an acquired taste, I grew up on it. The chef at this restaurant cooks so much like my grandfather that passed on in 1995, that every time I want to remember my grandparents, I order from this restaurant.. The food is amazing...I promise you would never be disappointed here. I also love that when you order Won Ton Soup, they ask if you prefer Bok Choy or broccoli...
author: Sakkara C.

description:
I love me some Golden Kim Tar.  It's one of my favorite food spots in the Loin.  The service is pretty poor.  The ambiance is non-existent.  Wearing flip-flops on Larkin may or may not lead to stepping on a discarded needle.  And if you ask about Dr. Pepper, they think you want extra pepper (Yes, this really happened.  And yes, I cried like a girl when I ate my lunch.)  But here's where the magic is made...

Super Delicious Mongolian Beef over Rice at GKT... $5.25
Rubber Chicken Sandwich Combo at the Civic Center Burger King... $8

I love me some Golden Kim Tar.
author: Adam W.

description:
A-OK.
$6 for General Tso's Chicken over rice.
Did not taste like General Tso's Chicken, more like Lemon Chicken or Orange Chicken, but I guess that's okay.
author: H. L.

description: I love this place, it's my favorite Chinese delivery. The food comes fast, and is just delicious, way better then Andys or any of the many delivery places around here. I especially love their prawn dishes, most places overcook them. Golden Kim Tar consistently delivers perfectly executed shrimp, and I'm a happy man!
author: andrew f.

description: I don't usually come to these places, because they seem forgettable.  But, I was in a late-night pinch (9pm-ish) and so just ordered their daily special, string beans and chicken.  I mean, standard Chinese take-out fare, but it was quite good!  In particular, I really liked the rice - perfect texture, and absorbed the sauce perfectly.
author: Gerald C.

description:
How does this make sense?  If one is chinese.  They eat chinese food for dinner everyday, yet they'll want chinese food for lunch too?  Well, that's my coworker for you, and I guess it's ok since 60% of the group were not chinese.  

But, it's good to know at least the place I went to today for lunch was alright.  It's really really close to my work and they have excellent prices.  But all the stereotypes you have on chinese restaurants, this place has it.  From the unusual arrangement of tables, to the wooden chairs which are feel uneasy and should get replaced, to the sticky tables.  

And definitely, it seemed like everyone and their mom's in the civic center area came here at 12pm on the dot.  We were fortunate enough to walk over by 11:45 am to get a seat and order.  I ordered the Mongolian Chow Fun $6.50 and it wasn't too bad.  I'll admit, the chow fun wasn't stuck together like most places and it was cooked well and plenty.  But the flavor just tasted like soy sauce.  For Mongolian, I'd expect a lilttle more peppery flavor.  And the raw onion, no no no.  Do not give me that.  

Overall, the service was rather slow, food was mediocre, came with free soup, oranges, and fortune cookie for $7 including tax/tip.  Good way to fill up on your lunches in the CC or TL.
author: Vincent K.

description:
Golden Kim Tar isn't too bad. Their food is alright and they normally give you a lot of food. I normally buy the chicken with string bean over rice meal and I can't even finish it a lot of the time because they give me a lot of rice. lol. This is a good place though.

The service at this place is great. The cashier who is normally there is nice. She asks you for your order and she is very patient with you, even though she is taking like a million orders and giving other people their food at the same time. lol. She's cool though. 

The only beef that I have with this place is how long it takes to get your food. Around lunch time, if you come in to order your meal, it might take about 15-25 minutes. If you order your meal on the phone, it might not take as long, but it still takes a long time. Other than that, this is a pretty good restaurant.
author: Otis B.

description:
The food is okay.  Average in every respect, but it's not like the place has any aspirations of being considered a world-class dining experience.

The prices are good, the delivery is quick and the service is better than expected for a Chinese place.
author: Darren C.

description: After a rough night and you are having a day where you want to be a bit lazier, the best thing is to order some quality delivery Chinese food!  The food is pretty tasty and good bang for the buck, but the real treat is the speed on how it comes and the free bonus gift that they give if you order 2 entrees.  The bonus comes out in the form of free fried rice, egg rolls, drinks, and other goodies that I don't remember.  I will definitely have to order from them again soon.
author: Min P.

description:
My Boyfriend and I discovered Golden Kim Tar by happy accident a few years ago while searching for affordable food near down town. When we drove up we were very skeptical. From the street it looks like almost any other hole-in-the-wall Chinese joint in the tenderloin, but we were  desperate and went in anyway.

I AM SO GLAD WE DID.

We go on a pretty regular basis and the waitress, Stacy, is great. She knows us by name even when we haven't been there in months and is very neat and quick. All the service is fast and the place is always clean and comfortable. The menu is very affordable and for dinner, any two entrees come with free fried rice or chow mein and soup or egg rolls when you dine in. 

The food is flavorful but not salty (and contains no MSG- we know because my boyfriend is sensitive to it and would have had a bad reaction) and not greasy like most cheap Chinese food. Our favorites entrees are Spicy Tofu and Green Beens, Spicy Eggplant and Tofu, Orange Chicken and Honey Walnut Prawns. they have a great selection of vegetarian dishes and are happy to make things less or more spicy for you. All the portions are very generous and we usually split two entrees and end up with a meal's worth of leftovers even though we gorge ourselves.

I would suggest this restaurant to anyone in SF and have taken friends to eat there on several occasions.
author: Freya G.

description: Very good Chinese. Quality is always great and the Thai curry soup with rice noodles cured my cold! Delivery is fast and courteous. I don't give 5s very often
author: Ryan Y.

description: Hated it. I do delivery Chinese a lot and have been on the search for the best around. I ordered the General Tso's chicken and Honey Walnut prawns. Both were terrible. The chicken was not crispy at all and felt like the chicken was not completely cooked through. Seriously, I felt sick after the first bite. I couldn't tell you if the prawns were better or worse. Again.. not crispy at all. The sauce wasn't integrated with the shrimp, but just drizzled over the soggy shrimp. It had this weird lemony aftertaste that was just nasty too. Delivery was timely, but I'll never oder from here again.
author: Elli S.

description:
Breakfast including eggs, sausage and pancakes for under $5??? Have I been magically transported back to the '70s or something? The waitress was sweet and friendly, and it was cute to see her get kind of absent-minded when there were lots of customers. (Hey, I have Adult ADD, too.)

The eggs were average, tasting a little like whatever had been grilled on the skillet prior. The sausage was tasty but greasy. The pancakes were delicious and so filling, I just could finish the last forkful.(Although, I did make room for the orange wedge and fortune cookie. There must be some psychology to that.)

I am so sick of  restaraunts providng a little thimble of syrup to go with a big plate of pancakes. The waitress at Golden Kim Tar dropped off a big ole bottle of Aunt Jamima at my table and I could have died happy. Also, it was nice getting my coffee in a to-go cup, in case I needed to take it on the run.

This place rocks!
author: Alex H.

description: Two friends (who shall remain nameless) order from here whenever I visit for TV night ... and apparently they order from here every other night of the week, as well, because when we phoned in our order Monday evening, the Golden Kim Tar people immediately knew who it was and asked, "123 Main Street,* right?" I had an uproarious laugh at my pals' mortified expense. Anyway, pluses include FAST delivery, TONS of food for the value, and it's actually quite TASTY. The Crispy Beef and General Tso's Chicken are both standouts, as well as the Pork Fried Rice. You could definitely do worse when it comes to cheap Chinese grub. *Street address changed to protect the innocent fat 'gurls.'
author: Gregor G.

description: Fast ordering online or call in for lunch, a bit pricy for lunch...but acceptable. Food...3 stars...to go service....4 stars....friendly is always a plus!
author: Blackbear Y.

description: I like the food, service and the price at this restaurant. Sometimes my co-workers and I will order 2 entrees and pick it up so we get a chow mein or fried rice for free. Thats enough to feed 4 people for under $20 so it's not bad and sometimes we even have leftovers.  I like the spicy eggpplant w/ Chicken and Shrimp. I was never a Moo shu fan but I like the Moo Shu chicken from Golden Kim Tar. I don't care much about the wrapper. I like to eat it with steam rice.  We also order party trays from them when we have a party at work. Their chicken wings are pretty good too.  It's one of my favorite place for chinese food  in the area.
author: Annie C.

description:
First night living in our new place in the Civic Center and looking for some delivery food because we were still unpacking and stuff.  Found this place on Yelp and figured we would give them a try. 

Ew.  The food was lukewarm and really really greasy.  We ordered the general's chicken and some vegetable chow mein...simple stuff, right?  The chicken was covered in a tasteless sauce and, by the time it reached our house, had soaked through what I was assuming was supposed to be crunchy chicken pieces.  The vegetable chow mein was all noodles and no vegetables and the noodles were disgustingly greasy.  

Doubt we'll try them again...
author: Tysen C.

description: I'm going there for lunch quite often recently. They are always extremely busy, I mean it's like they are at war. Yet they are just so friendly and seem to be almost relaxed. So that's nice! The food is plenty and good. I'm vegetarian, so I don't eat the menu up and down, but what I eat is great. I love their fried rice! Oh, and did I mention it's a lot.
author: A B.

description:
We order lunch from here ALL the time!!! 
The lunch specials are great, service is always friendly, our food arrives hot & tasty (in cornstarch containers a major plus) and the delivery guy ROCKS! 

Is it the best I've ever had? No, but its definitely consistent and good- no complaints here :)
author: Anna S.

description:
Me and Chinese food don't usually mix, but this place single-handedly caused me to question my ranking of favorite cultural cuisines.   It's cheap and good.  That wins me over.   I'm a simple gal with simple pleasures.

What was had:
"Special" Hot & Sour Soup.  Special means you get choice of meat, and a mini mushroom bouquet.  This was great.
Spicy Basil Chicken.  Just spicy enough and it had many crispy slices of lotus in the mix, which I loved and don't usually find in my typical Chinese restaurant.
Seafood dish in lobster sauce.  Looked good... heard it was alright. Milky white... couldn't really tell ya since i don't do surf.

Service was great.  I guess they were a family, because even at 11pm their little boy was running about, and (a little scary) outside in the dark - it's still in the shady part of town.
author: Marjorie B.

description:
OK, Golden Kim Tar proves that there is good Chinese food all over the City (even the loin).  The caveat is that you have to order correctly.  Kim Tar can be a godsend or as bad as it gets based on what you order.  

First Rule:  It should be fried.  Stir Fried, deep Fried, whatever.  

Second Rule:  Don't order anything that looks like Vietnamese food.  It is all terrible.

Third and most important:  Remember the price point.  Your not at Tom Kiang or R & G Lounge.   This is the Tenderloin.  

As you eat your bowl of wonton soup take a moment to enjoy the homeless warming themselves (shoes off) in the sunshine.  It's good to be inside.....
author: Anthony K.

description:
I usually come here for lunch and their lunch is not so bad for what you're paying.  It gets busy during the lunch hour, so it's best to order to go, or go after 1pm.  

Today, my coworkers and I ordered AMERICAN BREAKFAST from here. We've been trying to order breakfast from here the last two weeks, but just never got around to it, until today. We ordered a Denver Omlett ($4.25) which comes w/your choice of hash brown or french fries and toast. We also ordered their 2-piece french toast for $2.50.  Besides the cheap prices....they DELIVER. The delivery guy came rather quickly (I work about 4 blocks away). The omlette was not greasy and the french toast was perfect!


4 stars for you Golden Kim Tar.  Good job.
author: Jocelyn W.

description:
I've only tried a couple of items -- the salt & pepper calamari (decent...definitely saltier, spicier and more plentiful than at Ken's Kitchen) and the Malaysian style chow fun (tasty, but Chinese sausage kinda skeeves me out) -- but they were super friendly and fast and they threw in a free soda.

Here's the thing that makes these guys stand out from the crowd:

ATTENTION ENVIRO-NERDS! ARE YOU LISTENING?

They brought me my food in cornstarch containers! I mean, the cornstarch containers were in a plastic bag, but I'll take cornstarch over plastic or styrofoam any day.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
so far this is the best chinese foods for take out - and fast delivery. we live in alamo square and this place delivered so quickly, we were so impressed. 

the foods is delicious and fresh when it arrived, and the bonus is they don't use a lot of oils like other chinese restaurants does.  my boyfriend i are now a big fan. we'd recommended this place to anyone who love chinese foods, and the people here are super nice, and the prices are very reasonable. 

i guess this will be our only place for chinese take out and delivery. 

LOVE LOVE
author: Frances T.

description: I ordered take-out from this restaurant and the order arrived within 25 minutes. The food was hot and portions were huge! The vegetarian egg rolls are hecka good. I'll definitely be ordering from them in the future.
author: Maria J.

description: so many faux meats for me! sesame, lemon, general cho's meatless chicken ... amazing veg potstickers... HONG KONG style noodles.... wowowowowowo! ive been ordering from here on Eat 24 and absolutely love it.
author: Christine B.

description: Chinese is kind of like pizza, it takes a lot to make a standout meal. Golden Kim Tar did that on two levels. First of all, the eggplant lunch special was delicious. Perfectly cooked eggplant served in a great spicy sauce with rice was just what I was looking for. The second level of awesomeness was that it was $5.55 for lunch. A steal in the Tenderloin just across from the Federal Building. A new go to spot!
author: Rebecca D.

description: Don't miss their Tomato Beef over Rice, paired with hot tea, free hot soup, and a spoon of shredded red peppers in the jar on the table. The beef is tender, green pepper, onion, and tomato are all cut in perfect size, and they melted in the mouth.
author: Terry H.

description: Food was cold when it arrived, but that's no surprise considering it took 1 hour 19 minutes when on Seamless it states a delivery time of 30-45 minutes.
author: S W.

description:
maybe i got lucky, maybe  this is standard, but the delivery arrived within 20 minutes of ordering everything as asked and the delivery guy was a happy bloke. while i worried i'd not ordered enough for the three of us i was quickly proved wrong and tomorrow's lunch now sits in the fridge.

potstickers: hot and tasty. if you like the japanese style of "gyoza" you might not like these. very traditional i thought.

maapo dofu: excellent and delivered in a tub rather than box which is smartt. good and spicy.

special chow mein; could they put more noodles  in that box??? excellent quality and good mix of many things. that's MINE for lunch tomorrow....

prawn in black bean sauce: again quite good and nice mix of veg and prawns. will order again (as with all the above) 

Kung pao chicken: okay, here's where it went from 4 to 3 stars. it was more like vegetable kung pao stir fry in black bean sauce. WTF? chicken quite thin in the mix and when found rather sad and meager. and in side by side taste tests, literally, i could have sworn the prawns and the kung pao  were cooked in the same sauce. identical red bell peppers pulled from either dish tasted EXACTLY the same. Fail.

last but not fatal, i think i caught a wicked MSG buzz off the whole thing that forced me into the "Man Down!" formation on the sofa straight after. or maybe i just had a long day...

anyway, will definitely try again if for no other reason the great delivery experience  and that special chow mein.
author: S L.

description: The chow mein is really good here. The vegies are fresh & plentiful. Sometimes I get tomato chow mein, & they substitute tofu for beef. Very tasty. Great service.
author: Wan T.

description: We've ordered from Golden Kim Tar a couple of times and the food is really good, especially the Honey Walnut Prawns - yum!
author: Mark T.

description:
Don't go out of your way to come here. If you're in the neighborhood, and are hungry, you can count on them to be quick and yummy. But don't expect to be wowed.

Cheap, fast delivery. Decent food. Don't order anything fancy. The Wor Won Ton is great, so it the fried rice. The potstickers are a little too doughy for me, but I still order them, cause let's face it - they're still potstickers. They make their won ton fresh every morning. And they use CORN STARCH CONTAINERS! YES! No plastic or styrofoam. Happy day! Love em. I get my food in 30 minutes flat.
author: Mindy L.

description: Lemmon chicken was yum. Service was very sweet, not a common thing at most Chinese restaurants I've been to in my four years in the Bay Area. I'd come back for that reason alone (if I wasn't moving).
author: Valerie M.

description:
Super cheap prices in addition to free hot and sour soup and fruit with every order, make this place great for anyone on a student budget like myself. My only gripe is that the Mongolian Beef was really bland and not good at all. Probably the worst Mongo Beef I've ever had. I'd like to go back and try something else though just to give them a another chance. With their prices as low as they are it'd be unfair not to give them another shot. 

PS - They have free delivery. Sweet!
author: Tommy P.

description: I love this place. Its not the nicest of decor but its what you expect in the TL. The food is always good and really cheap.
author: stephen c.

description: I live on cheap take out.  I love cheap take out.  This place is really gross.  I had to throw most of it away.  Also they didn't confirm my seamless order until like 30 min after i ordered in which time i had had multiple email and phone exchanges with seamless employees.
author: Shane R.

description: I would have rated higher, but the scallops were breaded and fried, upon eating the first scallop, I couldn't taste the scallop or find it inside.  This sent me on a search for my scallops.  Turned out they were in there but shaved pretty thinly.  Once I started peeling off the breading I got to the scallops.  I discarded the mega breading and was left with an incredibly small pile of scallop shards and a huge pile of fried breading.  I then tasted the scallops, they were really very delicious and perfectly cooked and very succulent.  The walnut prawns were delicious, although breaded.  The shrimp fried rice was great, again the seafood was never overcooked, I really appreciate that.  So, be wary of the dishes, it appears it could be hit or miss.  I am not sure if I will give thwm another try or if I will pass, if I do try again, the mouthful of scallops for 13 bucks won't be among my selected items unless they get rid of the mega breading.
author: Jimmy D.

description:
I thought since this place was crowded, it would be a good sign that the food was decent.  I was wrong and doubt anything could get me to go back.

I didn't expect too much from this fast paced spot.  I am happy to eat mediocre lunch food  at other area Chinese restaurant.  But I ate the roast duck and it was so incredibly salted that I actually felt "off" for the next day.
author: Adam R.

description:
You could possibly count decent dining places with one hand in the Civic Center. However, Golden Kim Tar stand out as one of the best. No fancy frills, no nonsense Asian-Confusion cuisine. Just plain , good ol'  food. And by gosh! It is good!
 
As soon as you sit down, you will get a pot of hot tea. You will get your soup of the day, and today I got egg and vegetables soup. With that I had my veggie allowance alone.
I asked for the Broccoli Beef rice plate. It came out steaming hot with a generous serving of white rice. The beef was smothered in a light sauce, and the broccoli was abundant, tender to the teeth, and the sriracha was really handy just enough to add the extra kick that was missing in my day.
My bill came and it was $6. Six bucks! Tea, soup, and a yummy meal, not to mention great service. For that I will be thankful. Oh, and don't forget the pork pot-stickers. They are delish!
author: Art C.

description:
a good lunch place...with the rice plate comes soup, a slice of orange and a fresh fortune cookie. the salt and pepper chicken wings are especially good.

OCTOBER 2012 UPDATE

i stopped coming here. whenever i ate here i went back to work and to the toilet. it happened to another co-worker too. msg? grease?
author: Mr G.

description: Great prices, good food, and really fast delivery. They are also one of the few places to make Singapore Rice Noodles, which I love.
author: M Y.

description: Most of the time, I eat in, and so far, I really enjoy their food.  The price is good, the food is pretty good, and the people that work there are very nice.  The Won Ton Combination noodles are pretty good, and the broth does not taste hecka MSG like.  I also like their fried tofu, chicken wings, and egg rolls.  Overall, good price, good food, so why not?
author: Bernie C.

description: Well where do i start hmm first time at Golden Kim Tar it was good loved the chow fun there was a long wait but i had time. Second time around i ordered online waited a hour walked out and went back to work. A 1hr and 20 min later the delivery guy dropped off the food and still charged me. I figured I was going a the wrong time so a co-worker and I went for a late lunch and the service was great but as we finished our meal we noticed a cockroach on the wall. At this point I could only laugh. Overall I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
author: Ivette K.

description:
One of the friendliest, most economical restaurants I've been to in San Francisco.
The Husband/Wife team that runs the place is simply amazing. They are always very polite, friendly and try to build a good rapport with their customers. The food is always in large portions and served really fast. This may not be a fancy, modern restaurant in a great location, but they make up for it with awesome service. Many other restaurants could do well to understand that good service is more important than ambiance, cool sounding menus and pretty waitresses. I used to be a regular here till I had to cut down on outside food for health reasons.

I heartily recommend this place to anyone on a budget who wants to have a good meal in friendly settings.
author: Vivek J.

description: Fairly decent food, the item I ordered seem kinda bland but it was good. I would go back if i were in the neighborhood again
author: Mike G.

description:
Meihua, the owner is very freindly and always remembers me when I enter the resturant. 

They offer both Hunan & Mandarin Chinese Food and FREE Delivery. 

Their customer service is great and  I frequent their restuarnt in part because of their location.  Everything I have tasted so far from the menu has always been tasty and filling.  I highly recommend.
author: Alex R.

description:
Golden Kim Tar is terrible, but what are you gunna do, huh?  Isn't all chinese delivery bad?  The lady who takes the phone orders is nicer than your average chinese, though.  

I can't say the food is any better than most chinese places, but I also can't say it's any worse.  The delivery was extra quick, and the delivery guy was sweating balls.  I think he ran to our building or something. 

Mikey shat in less than 10 minutes after eating extra spicy string beans and tofu.

Stephie says the potstickers are too doughy.  Hey!  She likes a papery potsticker!  What the hell does she know about chinese food?

**If you order 2 entrees you get a free order of fried rice or chow mein.

Does anyone know where you can get some dope cold noodles in the city?
author: Steph and Mike A.

description: Yes I am def a fan! So i had this craving for Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce and i had to have it. Other places i tried were a little ridiculous. I looked in our drawer and found one of their menus that were dropped at our door! They were awesome, give you tons of food for the price, plus an extra free entree that was fried rice! Def had left overs for lunch tomorrow. I called and order and bugged them like three times calling back and forth and adding little things. Totally cool and helpful. I will be ordering again soon! Make it a Chinese night with them. And free delivery...duhh!
author: Tiffany d.

description:
I work right by this place and I've gone a few more times than I should have. I give three stars just because this place has huge portions for the price. 

I know Chinese food can get greasy but wat the frick? Seems like they throw on a couple tablespoons of grease after they're done cooking just for giggles. 

The service can get really slow at lunchtime but that's forgivable. Haven't tried the breakfast here...but should I?
author: James Y.

description:
My order: veg pot stickers, lemon chicken, and vegetarian delight
Time: 6:30pm on a Tuesday

Delivery took 40 minutes, which is the only reason I'm cutting a star. The food was great. The chicken was breaded and in a sweet lemon sauce. No vegetables were served with it, so I'm glad I ordered some in another dish. The vegetarian delight was wonderful - blanched, then lightly sauteed broccoli, tomato, water chestnut and baby bok choy. The veggies were light and crisp with garlic and ginger, and not drowned in a heavy oily or sugary sauce.

I'll definitely order again.
author: Aimee K.

description:
I work at the Federal Building across from the GKT restaurant.  I have a short lunch hour and don't have time to wait an extra 10 to 15 minutes after my order has been promised.  Today, I went in and ordered and was told 10 minutes... 15 minutes later I returned and my order was not ready; and, I waited another 10 minutes with numerous "I'm sorrys" in between.  Promise me 10 minutes and take an extra 5 minutes = OK.  Tell me 10 minutes, I give you 15, and then have to wait another 10 (25 minutes total) = NOT OK. (Reminds me of a Seinfeld episode!).

This is not the first time this has happened.  More like the 3rd or 4th.  So, I'll do like a responsible consumer and look elsewhere.
author: Larry B.

description: Well, just don't order from the internet.  Call them.  I think because they now have my address in the system, it's easier for them to find my place.  My food took less than 20 minutes to arrive.  Piping hot, and could feed an army.  BBQ Pork appetizer is covered in sesame seeds, and is not as "roasty" as I wish it could have been.
author: Kat M.

description:
Look, you don't get between a girl and ngau lam mein (beef stew noodle soup), all right? Maybe it's one of those Cantonese things like when you're craving pei dan jook (preserved egg congee) or egg custard tarts, but nothing else will do. And I'm only Cantonese on my dad's side. 

At any rate, I walked in here with the boyfriend, and when I saw that they had beef stew, that was it, and we agreed to not have stuff family style, 'cause he's a pescetarian. So the waitress came over and he ordered some veg spring rolls, a shrimp dish and rice first, and I ordered a bowl of beef stew noodle soup. She vehemently tried to persuade me to order family style and get a bunch more dishes. I explained that he doesn't eat red meat or poultry, and that I really wanted the ngau lam mein. She then tried to persuade me to order some seafood dishes. I told her that I really wanted ngau lam mein, and that I didn't want seafood. She pointed at the vegetable dishes. Again, I said that I really wanted ngau lam mein. Having tried and failed to persuade me to order meat, seafood, or vegetables, totally exhausting the menu of options save for appetizers, she finally smiled at me and said that if I wanted ngau lam mein, then I could have ngau lam mein. Yeah, it came out piping hot, the noodles were fine, and the stew meat that combination of chewy and tender that it's supposed to be, but the stew itself was really more like a thin broth with a few too many big old chunks of ginger. It also had broccoli, which is not what you usually get. I don't know. Maybe I shouldn't have insisted on ngau lam. The veg spring rolls were good, though.
author: Kristina L.

description: Menu CLEARLY says FREE DELIVERY however you have to order 10 dollars worth of food for Free Delivery. Hmmmmmm. I was hung up on when I brought this to the owner's attention. She screamed, hung up on me and tried to talk over me. RUDE! isn't even enough to discribe how horrible she is! Totally unprofessional and their menu is competely misleading. Also, my 7.95 orange chicken turned out to be 9.75! She wouldn't deliver for "free" until I ordered something else! She's going to try to grind ever dime out of you.............be prepared!!! Or, better yet.........pass on this dump!
author: Tom J.

description:
My favorite place to get Chinese for hella cheap in SF (that i've been to so far). Their open late, they have a good selection, and they have heinekken. LOVE IT. The service is kind, and they hustle hard to get all that food out. I love getting take out from here, (tenderloin makes me nervous), they are super quick and lovely for stoner munchie time with Seinfeld.

I reccomend it for groups, people with kids, business men.. shit anyone.
author: Katie M.

description: This is a great restaurant.  They have awesome food, reasonable prices, and wonderful service.  I recommend Golden Kim Tar if you are looking for a great neighborhood hideaway to eat some good food!
author: Sunshine S.

description: I visit this restaurant less and less frequently. The owners, husband and wife, are generally pleasant. However, the food is frequently substandard and inconsistent. I used to order the salt and pepper pork chop, but no more after paying for essentially a huge portion of fat and bone a couple of times.  I tried their vegetable egg foo young a few times and liked it. It had nice chunks of broccoli, carrots, onions,etc. You have to pay extra for rice so that's a rip-off but a lot of Chinese restaurants in this city do that. Tonight they used canned peas, carrots and corn in the egg foo young. No fresh veggies except the bean sprouts. What is it with these Chinese restaurants and canned vegetables? I had the same experience with Manor Coffee Shop (see my review). Also, the gravy was tasteless. It's listed on their menu under chef's specials at $8.25. Ok, I know that "chef''s specials", especially at Chinese restaurants, don't really mean anything, but considering the canned vegetables, it's a form of false advertising. Another dive Chinese restaurant. Survives, like many of them do, because of delivery orders. It's in a convenient location, and their garlic eggplant appetizer has always been delicious so I haven't given up on them completely, but I'm not recommending them at all.
author: Reynolds L.

description: Not a destination for foodies, but who cares.  Great Chinese comfort food at extremely reasonable prices.  I got the combination chow mein today, and it hit the spot.  The service is fast, too.
author: moosedog i.

description:
i work right by Golden Kim Tar, and I get my lunch from there at least once every two weeks.   their menu is about 3-4 pages long with lots of good stuff.  they have lunch rice plates which is what i usually get.  you get a nice serving of the entree, your choice of brown/white rice, and a cup of soup.  you can ask to replace the rice with chow mein for $1 more.  i usually get the mongolian chicken, which is nice and spicy enough for me, without being overwhelming hot.  it gets pretty busy around noon, so if you're just going to pick up, i suggest you call in about 20 minutes before.  service is good, i guess i've been going there enough that the ladies at the counter say hi and know what i'm going to order already.  

p.s. if you order 2 or more entrees, you get free delivery and free choice of 1. an order of chow mein or 2. an order of fried rice.
author: Ray R.

description: As far as delivery Chinese food goes, Golden Kim Tar is the best around. I recommend the General Tsao Chicken (spicy) and Sweet and Sour Chicken (or Pork if you prefer it) and I ask for it to be spicy in the comments box. My boyfriend is hooked on the Veggie Egg Rolls, but didn't like the Won-Tons (appetizer).  Delivery is pretty fast too.
author: Heather S.

description: Very greay chinese noodles but good soup. 1 for the soup, 1 for the price.
author: Razza M.

description: Affordable Chinese fast food and quick service even during the lunchtime rush (sit, tea, order, soup, lunch special, fortune, orange section in less than 21.3 minutes). Ideal office gossip venue. Less suited for the first date or any anniversary worth celebrating.
author: Pax, Formerly Known As Rufus D.

description: I had delivery to my hotel room while at a conference. The house special fried rice was good.  As with all chinese restaurants in san fran, they do not have duck sauce so those of you from the east coast, don't expect it. Also, they don't have my usual fare- lo mein. General tsos chicken was edible but not much more. Egg rolls were not pork but had a nice ginger taste.  The staff was very accomodating and tried to give me some sauce that I would like for my rice.  I had delivery twice and would have the rice again.
author: Veronica T.

description: Found a hair in my seafood fried rice the other day. I still ate my food though. There's nothing like stretching the big portion Kim Tar gives you over to 3 meals, even with follicle.
author: Linda L.

description: I probably would try this place one more time.  My work friend had sweet-and-sour beef with broccoli that looked good, while I stretched with a mango-shrimp-broccoli dish that sounds better than it tasted.  It was fine.  But considering how Golden House is around the corner and other fine Vietnamese places are up the street, it just doesn't stack up as well.
author: Laurel B.

description: Great prices, good food. I love their lunch plates. If only the environment was just a tad bit cleaner.
author: Haven L.

description: food is great, once u factor in the price its definitely 5 stars for a budget chinese place.
author: zafir s.

description: I ate here again, and had some sort of beef-and-broccoli sort of dish, and it wasn't nearly as good.  The vegetables were undercooked and it induced such thirst that I literally had to drink an entire bottle of water afterwards. I also had the rock cod again, and it was still great.  So, I'm downgrading this from 'great' to 'hit-or-miss'.
author: K. B.

description: I really like this place.  Food is pretty darn good.  Not amazing, but food comes out hot and there is a lot of it.  An entree and a side of rice is usually around 9 bucks with tax.  Good deal because you can take half the food with you home, since its so much.
author: Rusty W.

description: Fast, friendly delivery service. And the lunch specials are a bargain! Definitely recommend the Salt and Pepper Chicken Wings and the Rock Cod with Black Bean Sauce. Tasty, tasty. Shall have to try some of the other items as well.
author: Lily L.

description: Was a temporary lunchtime favorite when I was fighting a cold.  Always seems to be open when all other pho places are closed between lunch and dinner hours.  Basic wonton noodle soup consists of tasty dumpling nuggets with perfectly cooked shrimp and pork, simple broth and noodles for $4.95.  Some visits are tastier than others.  Ambiance is totally lacking, but service seems prompt and cheerful.
author: Esther R.

description: Not a bad place to eat.  I'd say it's one of the better chinese restaurants in the CC/TL area.
author: Matt P.

description: I would say this is a hidden gem for the area.  This place is packed during lunch.  The service is excellent - and fast, the menu expansive, the price is right.   The place is a bit cozy when busy, but the food is good and it is run very efficiently.  The quality and service has never disappointed.
author: Antonio E.

description: All I have to say, is if I can pay 12$ for pineapple shrimp fried rice, a import beer, and theres tinsel as the decor.. I am so down.. but honestly I would do take out, because watching a child watch the disney channel while his sweet heart mom slaves over a kitchen makes it impossible to not just leave a $20 on the table. you go girl, shes a sweet heart btw, i dont remember her name but tip her please.
author: mike s.

description: This place reopened awhile back with a new name and owners.  I've liked everything I ordered except for one shrimp dish because the shrimp still had the tails left on which made it messy to eat.  They give you a complimentary large container of house soup even with takeout orders, which is great  (I've never seen a Chinese restaurant do this).  They also give you a slice of fruit for free, also with takeout orders.  Usually it's melon (honeydew, cantaloupe or watermelon).  I've ordered takeout and they're nice enough to bring you the fruit to eat while you're waiting.  Nice friendly people and I like that they're trying to do a little more by giving you these extras.  Food is good and consistent, prices reasonable.  They just started serving American style breakfasts (opens at 7:30 am) and what a bargain.  Most items are under $4.  I had a sausage and cheese 3-egg omelet with hashbrowns, an English muffin and free hot tea for only $4.25.  It wasn't brimming with sausage or cheese, but plenty of egg and done right.  The hashbrowns weren't very crisp but I didn't mind.  Filling, decent and so cheap.  Great option for that area.  I noticed they do a pretty good takeout business for breakfast and I hope they continue to get enough customers to keep doing this.  I noticed they also offer their entire menu because a guy at the next table was eating some seafood pan fried noodles at 9:00 in the morning.  This is great because most Asian restaurants don't open for business until lunchtime.  All in all, I like this place and will definitely be going back.
author: Mimi L.
